Reviews.Title: “Absolutely recommended”
Reviews.Author: TVTravelerHaugesund
Reviews.Content: We always read reviews before booking a hotel, and have so far agreed with the review average ratings. This goes for the St Giles Hotel The Court too. Average rating is four stars. Agree! This was the first hotel we stayed in on our very first trip to the USA. Stayed there for four nights. Were out of hotel most of the day, and did not eat at the hotel. Would go back there next time we visit New York City! Good: Friendly staff, nice room, good amenities, location. Bad: Be careful with the use of toilet paper!! The toilet got jammed (fortunately the last morning). Guests should have been warned in advance - like e.g. some hotels in, say, Greece. Not good value for money, but I guess hotel prices are high in NYC. Similar hotels may cost as much.

Reviews.Title: “A great midtown hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PaulWorth
Reviews.Content: Spending 6 days here with my wife and 2 teenage daughters was great, it was the perfect location: a brilliant view of the empire state building, grand central station just 2 blocks away and many restaurants on your doorstep. The room was for the 4 of us and was a resonable size with 2 queen sided beds. But a limited amount of storage space. Very good upkeep on cleanliness. The staff were very helpful and recommended restaurants and places of interest. A gym was available 5 mins away as the hotel gym was under referbishment. The bar had a great atmostphear and was always buisy although if your looking for a quiet drink with the kids its not the place for you. we were shocked to find out that a cup of coffee was $9 and we would recommend buying own food/snacks for the room. Overall we were very impressed and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central, great base for discovering NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Snoozle
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has big rooms with big comfy beds, ideal location for site seeing, walking distance of Grand Central Station, The Empire State Building, The Chrysler and Times Square and with Grand Central on your doorstep anywhere else is just a subway ride away! The only negative was no tea/coffee making facilities, but we solved that problem when we discovered a fab little diner on the first morning - Scotty's, which is opposite the hotel on Lexington Avenue! We were hardly in the hotel and didn't try the bar or restaurant. The rooms have free safety deposits box, shampoo etc There's a mini bar (charged) and it was kept clean...no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackyhylton
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and four days at this hotel, this hotel was selected by hotwire was worried that it would not be up to standard but i can say - staff very helpful and nothing was too small special thanks to Jennifer and Gwon not sure i spelt his name right and yes the door man with the woolly hat who always opened the door for you and was ready to help at all times. There were two other reception staff but i don't rember their names. More importantly the location excellent in the heart of Manhatten, you really couldn't get lost. Yes i would stay again and i forgot to mention the front desk director who kindly assisted me with the use of the internet this hotel caters for everyone. I was abit worried about previous reviews i read regarding bed bugs and roaches in New York i am please to report that i did not see any at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's Alright”
Reviews.Author: DrunkenYank
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more out of this hotel based on its TrpAdv rating. I would definitely put this place at 3 out 5. Average is the word that comes to mind. AND should you stay here, ask for a room away from 39th & Lex. I was on the 6st floor over the intersection and it was LOUD. It did not prevent me from sleeping, as I'm not a light sleeper, but it was distracting at times. Check In/Out was quick. The staff was not exactly friendly, nor rude. Sort of indifferent. The room itself was spacious/350 sq ft. The bed was a nice comfortable king with nice pillows. However, the head board is covered in black cloth, which had nasty looking stains on it. (Food? Something nastier? EEEW!) The room looked clean until I went to plug in my lap top and noticed thick dust under the desk around the fixtures. The nightstand had part of it's finish worn off. Very 2nd hand and used looking. The baseboards were sloppily and unattractively sealed in places. The tiles in the bathroom had discoloration between them. I don't intend to make The Court sound horrible. All of these things were minor to me...with exception of the stains on the headboard! But I did notice. I had expected much better given the hotel's reputation. It's not a place I would seek out on a return visit to NYC. Though, the neighborhood is nice, and if I found a decent deal (Pd $120 + tax thru booking.com) I'd consider it. But only after checking other options. Not exactly a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent, hotel good.”
Reviews.Author: not_blufFINg
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days with my wife in this hotel during our trip to NYC. The hotel is easy to find (in the corner of E.39th street and Lexington Ave) and just a few blocks from Grand Central Station. A walk to Times Square takes about 15-20 minutes. Location is perfect and since it is not the trendiest neighborhood, the price range is moderate. There was some sort of renovation going on in the building but not in this precise hotel. The room was a bit worn from here and there but clean and spacious enough for two. The noise from the streets (our room was facing the Chrysler Building) could disturb someone but we slept good. Service was OK and friendly, and we got suggested to take a private car (SUV) to take us to the airport. It was a little more expensive than a taxi but much much more comfortable with several big bags. The room had a free wifi and they kept our luggage the last day while we were out getting lunch. There are some nice convenience stores, coffee shops, nail salons, barber shops etc in the neighborhood, so there's a lot to do there too, if you don't want to go and join the fuss on Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: fagana
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. We were impressed by the size of the room and the modern decor. On closer inspection, you see it's an old property that has been nicely camouflaged with modern fixtures. The furniture is quite old but has been painted black to make it sleeker. The bathroom is functional but really basic. The heating/ AC should be in a museum. We stayed during the week that it was really hot (80s) and it was impossible to sleep from the noise that infernal machine made, it was like having a drill going off every 45 seconds. We finally had to shut it off and endure the heat just to get some shut eye. The room was pretty clean. Overall, it was fine and if we had gotten a better deal (less than 200$/night), we would have been pleased. Next we're in NYC, we will look for something that is better value.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lesley909
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night trip here with 2 girlfriends. The hotel was good - staff very pleasant. The best thing is its location in MidTown. Its on the corner of Lexington Ave (Scotty's diner a great place for breakfast 30 yds from the hotel door). Its only 5 mins walk from Grand Central Terminal and 15 mins walk frm Times Square. There are 2 hotels(The Court and The Tuscany next to each other - they are refurbishing the one next door I think.) Reception area small and on the whole the hotel is in an older style rather than a modern, light, airy style - but thats not a criticism, just a comment. The bar was dark and atmospheric and the music was trendy and quite loud - not a problem for us, but I think some people have mentioned noisy rooms above the bar, which I can imagine listening to the music in there. |We upgraded to a terrace room - but be warned, if you do the same make sure you get a decent terrace. We moved rooms initially as I had booked the terrace suite after looking at the photos on the website - and the terrace they gave us first was scruffy and tiny with a rotten view. I told them this wasnt what was represented on the website and they changed it immediately without any hassle. (We were told we couldnt move to the one next to us, which had a lovely terrace as that was the owners one - it looked like the one the photo was taken in, which isnt fair of course! ) Our terrace room was a lovely size, a big bedroom with a walk in closet and a second large lounge with a very comfy sofa bed. Bose radios, dressing gowns, mini bar, nice furnishings, large tv in each room - very nice, no complaints. Bathroom was a little small, but absolutely fine. We didnt eat in the hotel so I cant comment on the food. I would certainly stay here again, the size of the room was the biggest positive, together with its general location.

Reviews.Title: “Never a DISSAPOINTMENT!”
Reviews.Author: Ferris B
Reviews.Content: If you ever need a hotel in NYC, ST GILES is the place to be!! The STAFF is GREAT! The ROOMS are GREAT! The SERVICE is GREAT!! Amazing VALUE!! And it is only a few blocks from all of the action. VIEWS are AMAZING as well. If you need a place for one night or a week, I highly recommend the ST GILES HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't know it was St. Patty's Day”
Reviews.Author: Beenaround73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March '07 during St. Patrick's Day weekend. I was staying in DC for a month and decided to head down for the weekend and didn't even know it was a holiday. Wound up booking at the Tucscany when it was still a W hotel. Showed up there and when I walked into the lobby area I was extremely happy when I thought about how much I had paid. Then as I was checking in I got metaphorically sucker punched. They had overbooked. I had no room. They said to quickly head on down to the Court, which was a sister W just a couple of buildings over on the same side of the street. Thinking the worse, I just went there and prepared for looking for taking a stroll looking for another place. I walked into a small dark lobby area, but looked quite chic. I must have been part Irish that day cause they initially said no rooms, but when they checked there was a couple of last minute cancellations and I got one of the rooms. Got my key and headed up to the room via a cool stainless steel elevator and when I got to my floor walked into what I thought was a club. The hallway was dark with minimal lighting and furnished with contemporary chic furnishings. Finding the room took a little effort at first because of the darkness, but soon figured out that the numbers were backlit so turned out to be quite easy after a while. Got to the room and was greeted by a huge bright room that looked simple but luxurious at the same time. The room came with a king size bed, large desk with plush velvety chair, heavy fabric black out curtains, comfy lounge chair, and a TV console although the TV itself was a flat screen mounted to the wall. The bathroom was also nice and large compared to typical bathrooms and came with super fluffy towels and great toiletries. Overall a great stay, not only for the comfort of the room, but the location of the hotel is in a nice quiet area, but close to many great NY places like Grand Central, Bryant Park, and the UN building.

Reviews.Title: “Our home in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: Quite simply, The Court is our home in NYC. I have stayed solo, with my significant other and with our kids and we have had a fabulous stay each time. The views of the Empire State Building are fantastic if you are on the SW corner...really stunning. The location is fantastic as we were able to walk a few blocks to Grand Central, 5th Ave., Central Park and many other great spots. Times Square is a short and inexpensive cab ride away. Once you are ready to wrap up the day, it really is like coming home to The Court. All of the suites are very large and well appointed with a chic decor and nice little touches. The beds are very good and the large sitting areas are great for entertaining friends before going out at night. The bar downstairs is hip but friendly and all the other hotel amenities are great. We always check out a little early to enjoy our last day in the city, and the concierge desk always does a great job taking care of our bags. If you really want to know what sets The Court apart, I have three words for you: Maria, Maria, Maria. Ms. Maria works at the front desk and is an absolute angel. I have stayed in great hotels all over the world and I have never encountered anyone in the hospitality industry who is as friendly, helpful, charming and so willing to go above and beyond to make sure our stay is stellar--each and every time, every single day. You can stay in lots of nice hotels in NYC, but you can only stay at one that has Maria. Her manager (I believe his name is Chris) is also a wonderful host and they are both extraordinarily accommodating and willing to go the extra mile. The rest of the staff is very friendly and helpful is well. They are doing something right at The Court. In summary: great location, large rooms above our expectations, amazingly good staff, and not just a good but a GREAT value overall. This is our home in NYC and we always feel like we are visiting family each time we stay. The Court is the only place we will stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: BuzzyBee_9
Reviews.Content: The Bad - Called at 10:30 to see if we could ck-in early, lady on phone was abrupt, said no and hung up. Was in the area around 2:00pm, stopped by to get the chk-in precess out of the way, the guys said come back at 3:00pm. The good - Came back at 4:00pm and Marie was on duty and changed out customer service opinion from below avg. to above avg. The hotel would do well to go out of their way to ensure this employee stayed with them. The rooms were very nice and clean. Linens were of good quality and the bed was very comfortable. Decorations were simple and modern. Wish we had more time to enjoy the room. Lobby bar - Young and modern but everyone was smiling and the bar staff was attnetive to everyone. Chk-out process went smooth. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value but needs a refresh”
Reviews.Author: Creamegg
Reviews.Content: We had booked to stay at St Giles The Tuscan, which is next door to The Court but we were given an upgrade due to its current closure for refurbishment. We booked the hotel based on the reviews promising quiet rooms and were delighted to be upgraded a second time to a 16th floor executive suite when we checked in, ensuring that we were well away from any street noise. We were also given a free wifi password, which we had expected to have to pay for. The location of the hotel is excellent, just a short walk to the subway at Grand Central Station and with Scotty’s and Blooms diners providing good value food just around the corner on Lexington Avenue, and Nirvana offering stylish Indian food in between them. Our room was huge with a spacious sitting area, large screen TV and sound system. The bed was also enormous and very comfortable but the bathroom was a bit small. It was all very clean but the room was also pretty tired. The bathroom had not had a refit for many years and the TV and sound system were ancient. We were only able to get a black & white picture from the DVD player, which the technician was unable to sort out, and on our last night the sound gave up all together. Our biggest issue however was with clunking heater pipes which happened every few hours, day and night. It was still preferable to the hotel above a fire house that we stayed in on our last visit to New York, but it did not make for a good nights sleep. I would not want to give the impression that it is a bad place to stay. We enjoyed our stay, and at the price we paid it was very good value for money considering its location, but it was not the height of luxury that the web site suggested. The staff was friendly and helpful and I would imagine that its sister hotel next door will be an excellent place to stay after its refit, which The Court also needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: lmitravel
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, walking distance to everything. Tasteful decor, very stylish. Rooms are ample size - esp for NYC - with nice furnishings and very comfy beds. Awesome bar opens up at night with mood lighting that serves expensive but excellent cocktails. After walking around the City all day, after taking in a Broadway show, after a great meal elsewhere, you finish the night in this stylish bar and then just float up to your room. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but that's it.”
Reviews.Author: Stassi78
Reviews.Content: We went during renovations so scaffolding and noise all the time. The rooms were dated, bathroom a bit feral with hairs left in the drain. The heaters in the rooms either blew out cold or warm air.... Even though we were seeking warmth Service was laughable, from concierges not having time or interest in helping to getting brushed off. Very random. Bad choice on our part. We we very tempted to check out, but since we didn't spend muc time in the hotel,, it wasn't that painful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: J K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel at the very minute for a steal! The front desk person was helpful and offered us an upgrade to a courtyard room and then gave us a standard room. We called down, and all was resolved quickly. The rooms are spacious by NY standards. Our room was clean and quiet, and the bed was so comfortable. The location is perfect. Easy walk to Grand Central Station and the NY public library. Plenty of restaurants to choose from in the neighborhood. The lobby and bar are for the young hip crowd, but we weren't the only hotel guests well over 40. The single drawback would be the basic no frills bathroom with slow drains....easy to overlook for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leaner65
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at the St Giles on March 4. We arrived at the hotel at 12 and our room was ready for us to check in. It was a good size room on the 12th floor. The bathroom was big, the bed was very comfotable and we had a great view of the Empire State Building. We stayed in the Court, the Tuscany is under renervation. There was a nice area in the lobby to sit, have a drink or play pool. The hotel was very quiet at night. The staff at check in and out were very nice, offering to holde our luggage while we walked around the city the next day and got a cab for us when we were leavling. I would stay there again.....very nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Got The Room at a Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: MedfordNewYorkDotty
Reviews.Content: I stay in NYC a lot since I live on Long Island. This hotel was a great price so I couldn't resist staying there. I would actually give it 3.5 stars because there were many things I liked about it. The room was very clean. The bed was very comfy as were the pillows. The desk staff, as well as the concierge, were polite and helpful. The location is great and in a good neighborhood. The only thing I didn't like was that the room they gave us had a lot of imperfections. If it wasn't for the great price these imperfections would have been quite bothersome. For one thing, the heater made an awful sound all throughout the night. Parts of the room were worn and in need of an update. The television worked intermittently due to a weak signal. I'm thinking the room price was so low because of these imperfections. Read other reviews to compare. Overall, I would stay there again at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location...”
Reviews.Author: Torontonian54
Reviews.Content: Yes indeed, the St Giles benefits from its excellent spot right smack near such centres of interest as the Grand Central Station -with its legendary Oyster Bar-, the Morgan Library, the Chrysler Building and the Empire State, just to name a few. But the spacious, comfortable,affordable, well appointed rooms, with nice amenities are an added drawing asset. I found the staff unfailingly courteous and helpful. The minus has been described elsewhere: the radiators do tend to clink clank clunk a bit. But I certainly would warmly recommend the St Giles.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, Wonderful value”
Reviews.Author: DLK26
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St Giles Hotel-The Court with a friend last weekend. This was my first trip to New York and this hotel surpassed my expectations. It has an excellent location only a few blocks from Grand Central Station. You can also walk all around Manhattan and take in the New York Public Library, Rock Center, Broadway, Times Square, etc. The room itself was quite spacious. The rooms are modern and clean and the bed was very comfortable. I was also surprised at how quiet it was. We didn't have a special view from our room, but for the price, that didn't matter. It was a great launching pad for exploring Manhattan. Service at check in and check out was very friendly. They were also happy to hold our bags for us when we arrived in the city early. The concierge was a bit brusque but she directed us to a wonderful restuarant in the West Village (Phillip Marie). Overall, I would definitely recommend tihs hotel if you get a good rate. I felt it was an excellent value at a couple hundred dollars per night.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Cockroaches!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelTruth
Reviews.Content: My room had huge cockroaches in the bathroom. The A/C- heat was loud. Lots of street noise. I was on the Lexington side.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good service”
Reviews.Author: innams
Reviews.Content: The rooms are relatively spacious for New York. It's a great location within walking distance of times square and grand central station.The hotel has a bar and a restaurant in the ground floor but didn't try either so can't comment on the quality of both. My room (on the 11th floor) came with free wi-fi, and the usual amenities of mini bar (usual new york pricing though), safe, iron and ironing board, temperature control, shower with attached bath, flat screen tv, free paper in the morning (USA today) and writing desk. Access to your floor on the lift is via your key card so the safety aspects are taken care. My flight was at 11pm so i needed to check out before noon but the hotel stored my luggage till i came back to collect. Positives-Great service specially from the front desk staff and doormen. Great lobby area with a pool table and lounge off to the side. Convenient location. Fast check in and check out. Negatives- The room i stayed in could use an upgrade of a few of the fixtures (the hanger holding up the ironing board was broken), would have been useful if the mini-bar had an ice-maker

Reviews.Title: “Excellent team. Best i ever met in NY”
Reviews.Author: Levdaniel
Reviews.Content: Great location. Rooms are the largest i found in that star rating. Excellent team. Especialy the concierge Juan Santamaria. He's the one that made the diferent between good and great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central and a good deal.”
Reviews.Author: jacabean
Reviews.Content: We stated at The Court for a 3 night / 4 day break in NYC in January, booked through booking.com on a special offer. This offer made it incredibly good value for money given the Hotels location one block away from Park Avenue. We could see the Chrysler building from our 7th floor bedroom window and Empire State and Grand Central are just a few minutes walk away. The bedroom was large with a good king size bed, en suite bathroom facilities and mini bar. The hair dryer provided was a bit useless but did its job eventually. Good, hot shower and plenty of clean towels daily, even toiletries were replaced every day which was nice. There is a mini bar in the room but as you'd expect it was very expensive. Negative points were that the room had to the or coffee making facilities, and there was free wifi in the hotel lobby area but you had to pay $14.99 per 24 hour period to use it in the bedroom. We didn't use the hotel bar or restaurant so can't comment- when you're in New York why be limited to your hotel??? There were lots of cafe's nearby and I particularly liked breakfast at Dunkin Do'nuts! Staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly. We arrived before the 3pm check in time and were quickly shown to our room. There was a lot of noise from the street but when you're in the city that never sleeps you have to expect it- we were so tired from walking all day we slept through it so it can't have been that bad. We would return to the hotel on a similar offer, however I wouldn't pay the rack rate. A good 4 star!

Reviews.Title: “Missing clothes, no answer, no refund, no responsability”
Reviews.Author: victorkpm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at St. Giles - The court, for 6 days on december 2011. In the 3rd day we asked for a bed linen change to the housekeeping. Whe we come back i discovered that was some clothes missing. I would not accuse the hotel for theft, so i suppose the clothes went to the laundry inside the bed linen. We questioned the hotel about the clothes several times, and they keep saying that they were still searching. On our last day (3 days after) we checked out, leaving the receipt of the clothes and our address, as if they found, they can sent it to us, or refund our credit card, if they lost our clothes forever. Since then i didnt received the clothes, neither the refund, they do not answer my emails anymore (i sent them 4 emails before writing a bad review). Our bill was more than 1.000 dollars, and the refund, less than 30 usd, just the exact amount of we pay to replace our missing clothes. I would not recommend st giles, there is a lack of attention in their faults, nobody of the staff felt responsible for that, and they started to ignore the costumer who want to solve the problem in a correct way. Nobody wants to have this kind of problem when traveling. I would look for other hotel, NYC has several awesome hotels with good care of clients.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Thanksgiving week in New York”
Reviews.Author: umcariocadorio
Reviews.Content: The St. Giles Hotel - The Court was a wonderful hotel for my 10 year old daughter and myself. We arrived on the red-eye from Los Angeles, and arrived at the hotel early on our check in date. The hotel was kind enough to allow us to check in early so my daughter and I could have a nap before beginning our explorations. The room was clean, large, with a great shower, Philosophy products in the bathroom. The only reason whythe hotel didn't get 5 stars from me was because it asked for $15.00 a day for internet. This may be the going rate, but I felt it was excessive.

Reviews.Title: “New Year in New York”
Reviews.Author: cheersbaby2009
Reviews.Content: Excellent boutique hotel and if you are lucky like us it has fabulous views of the Empire State Building. Location was perfect - round the corner from Grand Central Station and the Chrysler Building.The rooms are large, beds and pillows soooo comfy. The staff were always so helpful with any requests and queries and also upgraded us to a 15th floor suite as had printed out a voucher for an upgrade even though it didnt necessarily apply to our booking !!! so check the internet for vouchers before you leave ! I would have absolutely no problem in recommending this hotel to anyone.l cannot wait to return especially as the hotel is having a major refit so its a win win !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Peter D
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Grand Central Station, surrounded by great restaurants & bars. Hotel was clean, quiet, and rooms were much larger than what I expected for NYC. In fact, our room actually had its own private deck!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, big room, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: GinnyS01
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the St. Giles, The Court. The location is prefect for walking around mid-town and is only two or so blocks away from Grand Central Station so you have easy access to trains and the subway. Our room was big by New York standards and had recently been updated. There was no noise from the outside, which helped provide a great night sleep. The only downside was that we could hear every conversation that went on in the hall by our room. So my recommendation would be to ask for a room away from the elevator towards the end of the hall. Maybe this way the noise from the hall will be less.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but”
Reviews.Author: familyuvfour
Reviews.Content: The decorating in the room was modern and stylish. The radio was Bang and Olafsson. The carpet however had not been laid properly or had not worn well as it was wrinkled in spots and the fabric chair and couch looked a little "tired". The building is old and there was a substantial crack along the wall where the heating was. Little things but they took away from the overall feel of "Boutique hotel". We were upgraded to a suite (we had actually booked at the Tuscany next door) and the bedroom looked out to Lexington Ave. The windows and simple blind did little to mask the noise of the city (I always read this in reviews and think - what do you expect in the middle of NYC?) But the window air conditioner liner and simple white blind did little to help keep the noise out. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the bed and bath were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, Good location”
Reviews.Author: markybebru
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights starting on Christmas Eve. The room was fine although a little bit noisy (no double glasses). We had a small problem with the toilet flush an evening, the receptionis gently sent an "engineer" within 10 minutes and he quickly fixed the problem. The staff is very kind. The carpet was not perfectly clean, ideally it should be replaced by parquet floor. We also believe that for such a price in a 4 star hotel, there might / should be a coffee /tea maker in the room, espcecially during cold seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely expensive for what should honestly be 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sutheat
Reviews.Content: Extreme costs charged for every small thing including Internet ($15.00 per device per day) and $8.00 for a bottle of water that costs $1.69 across the street)

Reviews.Title: “Great room, iffy service”
Reviews.Author: Stellablu83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Dec. 30 with my sister and her boyfriend after a Phish concert. We had the largest suite with a large terrace and an amazing view of the Chrysler Building. The room was great until we opened the pull out couch and realized there were no sheets on it, and there were no blankets, sheets or pillows in any of the closets. I called down to the front desk and was told they will bring us up one pillow and some sheets but there were no blankets. Not that I was expecting a world of comfort from a pull out couch but it royally sucked. Moral of the story is this is a great hotel if you're sleeping in a bed!

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Yogi414
Reviews.Content: We had the junior exec room which is the size of 2 regular rooms. We look for size since we had 2 teenagers an brought an air matress for one and the other used the sleeper sofa. The king bed in the other room was nice and comfortable. When we asked for another blanket they only brought us bed sheets and said that is all they have which seemed a bit low budget. When we turned on the heater both heaters in both rooms made some noise but did not blow warm air which also seemed low budget. We called the front desk, the engineer showed up promptly and reset the heater and then they worked but continued to make some strange noises when the thermostat turned them on. The engineer seemed not very friendly, he did not say much, and seemed a bit tired from possibly resetting heaters?When this building got tuned into a hotel I suspect the heating and ac system was not replaced other than putting digital thermostats in the rooms. The location is great, not a far walk to most midtown attractions. All in all we give this hotel good value as the price was lower than most other hotels in midtown and the room was spacious.

Reviews.Title: “A Midtown Surprise”
Reviews.Author: GlobalConsultant
Reviews.Content: One get tired of over-hyped, over-priced Manhattan hotels so I found the St Giles Hotel - The Court a very welcome surprise in Midtown. The location between Park and Lex is convenient to the transportation hub at Grand Central. The lobby is busy and comfortable. The renovated rooms are a delight, spacious, light-filled with comfortable bed, work area, and excellent bath. Mine had a wonderful view of the Empire State Building. The staff is most willing to be of assistance. While not cheap, the St Giles offers much more for its price point than many of the hotels in the part of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: onedumgoy
Reviews.Content: I had booked the hotel on a "blind" travel site, so I have to admit that I wasn't that excited when I finally saw the name. I thought I knew most of the hotels in mid-town, but this was one that was definitely beneath my radar. The hotel ambience is very boutique-like, and check in was smooth and efficient. One of my pet peeves in NY hotels is elevator waits, but I could always get from the lobby to my 5th floor room in about 30 seconds. The room was completely updated and BIG by NY standards. Definitely one of the larger rooms I have ever had in the city. Everything was clean and the bed was modern and comfy. I recommend this hotel, which is not typical for most of the NYC hotels I have stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but not at 4-Star level”
Reviews.Author: Mj W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St. Giles Hotel in August and was both impressed and disappointed. Their location is awesome. You are two blocks away from Grand Central Station yet in more of a neighborhood area. There are also great restaurants within walking distance. This hotel was ranked as a 4-Star Hotel, but what I saw was less than 4-Star quality. While the rooms are gigantic (600-700 sf) and seem like apartments, the furnishings were on the cheap side and the carpets were worn and threadbare. Our air conditioning didn't work when we first arrived and the handyman told us that if we switched on a floor lamp, it would cause the air to turn off! The Master Bedroom had a very comfortable bed but for some reason, every time I laid down on the covers, I started sneezing. The bathroom was nice but very small. There was a mini fridge but no microwave or sink. We had a corner room, that faced Lexington, but the traffic wasn't bothersome at all. The Valet's and doormen were super helpful and they went out of their way to hail cabs or give directions. There is also a bar attached to the hotel right off the lobby. You get free Wifi in the lobby area but it is very, very small with limited seating. The St. Giles has two locations, right next to each other (The Court and The Tuscany ). You can use the spa or business center at The Tuscany and we even received food vouchers for $30 per day, that could be used at the restaurant at The Tuscany. We didn't ever make it there but the vouchers could also be used for the mini bar items. The rooms are HUGE in the St. GIles but after staying at the Affinia Dumont, which is only five blocks away, the St. Giles isn't even in the running anymore. The Affinia Dumont's rooms were much nicer and much more upscale. There are more and better restaurants all around the Affinia Dumont and they also have full kitchen's which further push them higher up the rating scale. If your choice is a regular hotel room in Manhattan or a suite at the St. Giles, then I would book the St. Giles for room size alone. A safety precaution yet a detriment - At the St. GIles, you have to use your room key in the elevator, each time you go up. That is great for security but a pain if you are carrying a lot of items. It got to be really annoying after 2-3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most”
Reviews.Author: chad b
Reviews.Content: We arrived just after 7pm on a Saturday and our room was overbooked (discount travel site), they quickly upgraded us to a suite which was large for NYC standards. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was updated with modern decor. Small bathrooms and elevators, but very manageable. Only complaint was the noise, the street noise is expected, however the clanking of the pipes all night was annoying. Good location, five minute walk to Grand Central and away from the masses at Times Square

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Much Larger Than Expected!”
Reviews.Author: BookOfTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in May 2011 on a weekend getaway to NYC. We booked it last minute and were pleasantly surprised upon arrival. The building is in a more residential area and the rooms are very residential in styling as well. We definitely felt like we were at home as our "room" having multiple rooms and more than enough space. It was easily the largest room we've had at a hotel (without booking a suite). The bathroom was also large, very modern and clean. We were also able to walk just about everywhere we wanted to go from the hotel -- Central Park was definitely a hike, but we did it nonetheless. The only negatives we had included a semi-cold reception at check in, but it was not terrible. And it was a little far if you want to walk up to Central Park. Other than that, it was overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great midtown location, pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: acquablue11
Reviews.Content: Very stylish rooms. Got a room at the back so it was very quiet. Like the flat screen tvs and Philosophy bath items. Can also bring your pet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: FrozenMargNoSalt
Reviews.Content: We took our kids to New York to see all the wonderful decorations for Christmas. This was a perfect hotel...we got a suite which had a pull out couch in the living room and a plush king bed in the bedroom. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location was great as well...39th and Lexington...much quieter than many NYC hotels we've stayed at in the past. Overall, great boutique hotel, would highly recommend. Oh yeah, and don't miss the fireplace in the lobby...perfect to thaw out your cold hands!

Reviews.Title: “amazing room with a view”
Reviews.Author: K_Vincke
Reviews.Content: clean, good service, close to all important transport links - and above all an amazing view on the empire state building!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to put your head at nite but not much else going for it.”
Reviews.Author: MJM1234
Reviews.Content: Its a fine hotel for the price, but seems somewhat run down, especially the bathrooms. Not much of a lobby to it at all and the rooms are small - you dont feel comfortable being in the hotel other to wake up and go to sleep. The place is trying to be modern but just comes off as tacky. Area is close to mid town but definitely feel out of the main scene. Also both mornings house cleaning was very noise in the halls pre 9 am. No room service after midnite and the radiator clicked throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for 1st NYC experience”
Reviews.Author: MissAY
Reviews.Content: A lovely centrally located hotel with great amenities. The door staff (Tony) and concierge (Tyrone) are really helpful and attentive and quick to engage with you. The room was clean and the sheets and towels were changed daily (although more dusting could have been done - but this was a minor for us). The bed was large and comfortable, and there was a separate walk in closet with safe, mini bar area and large mirrored area to do make up etc. The floor we were on 15th - was quiet. You can seriously get all over the city from this location as grand central is minutes away, and so are some good eateries. The cost was good for the area and the size of the room, and I would seriously consider returning here with a larger group, I just hope that they keep standards the same or better in the meantime. I couldnt get wifi access from the lobby - but went net door to the tuscany which was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, a pity about the wifi charges.”
Reviews.Author: hartley99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very conveniently on Lexington Avenue, about 5 minutes easy walk South of Grand Central Station. Our room was on the 11th floor looking out onto Lexington so lots of traffic noise during the day although, oddly enough, not too bad at night. Worth asking for a room at the back of the hotel if you crave quiet – but that’s never guaranteed in New York City. The room itself was surprisingly spacious with two queen beds, a roomy closet and a reasonably-sized bathroom. The hotel provides an extensive (which word could be replaced by “expensive”) room service menu but has no dining facility other than for breakfast – also expensive. So, for breakfast take the 30 seconds walk around the corner to Scotty’s Diner as helpfully suggested by other reviewers. OK, not fine dining or candlelit romantic suppers, but good, reasonably priced fare 24 hours a day. Note that Scotty's take out hot chocolate and coffee is significantly cheaper than a certain international chain 100 yards up the road. The reception and door staff were helpful especially with transport to JFK at rush hour on a busy Friday evening and they will hold luggage after check out in a secure area without charge. Only one niggle which is wifi access at around $20 per day. For a city hotel in this technological age, this is just exorbitant. So, take the short walk to Starbucks and enjoy unlimited wifi for the price of a cup of coffee. I can recommend this hotel especially for leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ABT70
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotel on a residential street just blocks from Grand Central Station. From there, you can hop on the subway to just about anywhere in the city. My room was clean and comfortable and nicely furnished with a modern/hip vibe. Got a great rate through a corporate account and was able to add on some personal days to my business trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very spacious and comfortable room, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Linda J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our 30th anniversary. When we checked in the staff was aware of our special occasion and without our knowledge upgraded us to an amazingly gorgeous room with all of the amenities we could have wanted. They were extremely helpful and attentive throughout our stay. The hotel is very centrally located, within walking distance to many sights including 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Center, and Broadway. It is in the middle of an East Side neighborhood so it is a very nice and quiet area to walk around in. Rooms are very large for a N.Y. hotel - bed and pillows were very comfortable. Shower was great! Will definitely return. Special thanks to front desk staff on November 29-30!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: texasgirl020
Reviews.Content: WOW..something that doesnt happen very often in NYC...very friendly staff, excellent customer service! Such a welcome change to what I usually run into in the city. The hotel is nice..the star rating is spot on. Its comfortable and clean. I had an inside room so it was also very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: RFBarnhardt
Reviews.Content: We found this small hotel through a deal offered by Amtrak, and it was as good a hotel as any in this price range that we've found. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was adequate in size and had a very comfortable kingsize bed. There was free internet in the lobby, but it cost $15 for 24 hours in the room. There was a continental breakfast for $15 per person in the hotel, but if you want something more substantial, go to Bloom's Deli just around the corner. The hotel is on 39th and Lexington, just a few blocks from Grand Central. If you're in NYC for the theatre, you may want to look for something closer to Times Square or on the west side, but if you don't want to deal with the Times Square crowds and scene, St. Giles Court is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Holds $100/night on card in addition to reservation amount.”
Reviews.Author: lil_sis1919
Reviews.Content: Only a few complaints...fridge didn't work. no coffee pot in room. asked for a crib when I booked the room and the hotel was out upon arriving, crib should have already been in my room. also, may/may not be a big deal for all, but in addition to your room charge they hold an additional $100 per night on your card.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Vern08844
Reviews.Content: We were able to get a room here at a reasonable price. WIth that in mind its a decent hotel. This is an older building that was renovated. It was clean, the rooms were updated. The bathroom was small, and the water pressure was OK but not great. Its about a 15-20 minute walk from the theater district. For being on a side street the road noise at night was relatively loud

Reviews.Title: “Great location - neighborhood feeling”
Reviews.Author: ninadg61
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the weekend and found this hotel to be a good value. The room was spacious with up-to-date finishes and a comfortable bed. The lobby bar was lively. There are many convenient places nearby for coffee, pharmacy, lunch, etc. And you are only blocks from Grand Central Station where you can get subway lines all over the city. The location is a taste of living in a true New York neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PanamaNB
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a few vacation days staying in the St Giles Court Hotel. It has an excellent location! Everything is close to the hotel, pharmacy, central station, the chrysler building, restaurants. Keep in mind next to the hotel you can find Scotty's Dinner and starbucks. The employees service was great! We forgot to print some monument passes and they offered printing them for us at no charge. The only recomendation that I can think of, is for them to provide an additional bath soap. They provided shower gel but some people are used to bath soap and they only provided one bar for the 2 of us during the 4 nights that we stayed in the hotel. The rest was perfect!. The room view will allow you to see the empire state through the windows of the room

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room but noisy”
Reviews.Author: FlemingSorensen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from friday to saturday. The bar at the hotel was very lively during the night. Lot of people. Had a room against Lexington Ave. There was a lot of noise from the Ave. Room was quite spacious and clean. The hotel need more renovation to stay up to date. If you get rooms at a fair price, then it can be good value for money. Paid $225 for a night. That's fair compared to rest of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect for Birthday NYC Trip!”
Reviews.Author: sutcliffe1121
Reviews.Content: Travelled here with my girlfriend for a 4 night break to celebrate her birthday. This hotel was absolutely perfect! Had emailed before hand to request room with a nice view. Upon check-in we were told our room had been upgraded to a slightly larger room than what we had booked. The room was fantastic, very large and spacious - not what you would normally expect for a city hotel. We were on the 14th floor with a view of the Empire State Building! Room had a radio/alarm clock with iPod/USB connection, phone, mini bar/snacks (good selection), plenty of wardrobe space/drawers, heating/air con controls, hair dryer, iron + board, safe, really comfy bed/pillows/duvet, large flat screen TV with plenty of channels, DVD/VCR and pay per view on-demand programmes. There was also a really comfy sofa by the window to chill out on. There is alot of street noise but you are in NYC. Bathroom was smaller but still a good size, selection of toiletries, bath robe and a great shower. Received morning papers and a couple of magazines. There was also a good book about NY in the room. Free wi-fi in the lobby, extra charge if you want to use it in your room. Staff were very friendly, room was cleaned every day no problems. Although we didn't go there, you are allowed to use the facilties/bar of sister hotel next door, the Tuscany. The central location made it a perfect base to explore the city. Grand Central Terminal is about 10 minutes away and this is where the NYCAirporter bus from JFK drops off, so very easy to get to. Check out was 12 noon. There is a place to leave your luggage in the lobby, its tagged and locked away - very useful as we were not leaving until around 4PM. Staff more than happy to help with directions, taxi's, transport back to airport. LEX bar looks brilliant, great music too. Mini bar/snacks in room are quite expensive but we expect this now in city hotels. There is a shop nearby which we went to for water/snacks for the room. This is a high quality hotel for a very reasonable price (we booked through Expedia). Very stylish, modern, trendy and there is a really good atmosphere. Perfect central location. We certainly hope to stay here again, definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great position, and the beds are sooooo comfy”
Reviews.Author: Jogger55
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of package for 3 nights in New York, having read good reports on Trip Advisor,...they were not wrong. The position of this hotel is ideal, so near to Grand Central Station and the Metro, also the buses that run to the airports for your transfers. It is also near to Empire State Building, 5th Avenue, The Rockerfeller Centre, Times Square and not too far a walk to Central Park. We did as suggested and asked for a room on a higher floor with views and were very lucky to get a room on the 10th floor with fab views of the Empire State Building. The rooms are so large and the beds and pillows sooooo comfy, just what you need after a day walking about NYC. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Hotel Needs Some Work”
Reviews.Author: s52
Reviews.Content: Look, this hotel is ideally placed. Right near 6th Ave and 39th, you can walk to all the central sites in New York. The lobby is small but nicely furbished, and the cafe is comfortable and accomodating. However, the rooms need work. We were with a small group. Our room was spacious, but the carpetig needs to be replaced as does some of the furniture. The bathroom was tiny. The other room in our group was larger and the furnishings were better. Bottom line, I might stay here again, but I would be more specific about which room.

Reviews.Title: “St. Giles The Court New York”
Reviews.Author: southernsister5
Reviews.Content: This quaint little hotel was great! The room was huge, by NYC standards, by most standards for that matter! The staff was very freindly and efficient. It is located a few blocks from Grand Central and within walking distance to Times Square, theatres, shopping and many attractions. I was very pleased! The only downfall is that it is in a residential area and there are very few mid-priced eateries, but other than that it was wonderful. One more thing, the bed was very confortable, the pillows, all down, were flat as pancakes. That is good.... if you like flat!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel - search for a good price online.”
Reviews.Author: RajBansal
Reviews.Content: Really top hotel which was in a great location. Search around for a cheap deal to make it worthwhile. Lovely hotel - very clean. Would come back in a heartbeat. The staff were lovely and very helpful. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: prayap009
Reviews.Content: the fist time i visited the hotel was past mid night during the peak thanksgiving season. by the team i reach i was turned down by a bunch of 6th avenue folks. the staff was helpful and have put in their best to find me a room. very helpful and courteous

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel indeed....”
Reviews.Author: WarrenlMilton
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at this hotel and I have to say the first stay was good and this stay was very good. Both times I stayed 5 nights in total and found the rooms styling very good and very clean, the second stay was in a junior suite and it was fanstastic. The only thing is the road noise but then you are in NY so what do you expect - this in no way caused an issue for me as it does filter into the background......worth mentioning but please do not let it put you off. I would say this Hotel is worth a stay and one my two occasions I have brought my wife and we loved it. The reception staff were very helpful and second to no one, the bar was good and the cocktails worht the money......gone on try something unusual. Did I mention the location - could not get any better even if you paid double!!

Reviews.Title: “No 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wepal
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a 4 star hotel. We booked an Executive Junior Suite Room and it was far from being executive. The room had a hole in the ceiling and carpet was torn and stained. The air conditioning unit was fitted into the window with plastic panels and you could hear all the sounds from the street (very noisy). The bathtub and sink would not drain (we complained, however it was not repaired). The lobby furniture was dirty and worn. The concierge was not very helpful. The doorman was not attentive and seemed as though he was not interested in his job. Robes were not provided, towels were thin. The hairdryer was dirty and hung on the back of door. Upon our departure, we spoke to the attendant at the front desk and she said that she could not do anything and gave me a card and encouraged me to call the number on the card to complain. It cost $260.00/night and ABSOLUTELY NOT worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: modesty55jacmel
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in the Murray Hill area of Manhattan for a number of years. I'm always hunting for a mid-town hotel, on the East Side, that offers comfort, cleanliness & good value. I had hopes for the St. Giles Court because of the reviews I read here on Trip Advisor. Maybe I was in a parallel universe because my room was small, overwhelmingly noisy and poorly designed and organized. The windows were filthy, the thermostat completely non-functional, the room was dark (until I figured out how to plug in a lamp), the bed sagged and the TV/VCR combo was located on a conference table parallel to the side of the bed so that it was impossible to use - without being a contortionist or courting a back injury. I had a massive walk-in closet, a separate room that contained nothing but a mini-bar - I requested a coffee maker and then couldn't plug it in in the mini-bar room - no reachable electrical outlet. There was a third room that held nothing but a safe, securely placed on a high shelf. It would have been preferable to have a room large enough to put the TV at the foot of the bed. Why the safe needed a room of its own, I haven't a clue. And I really didn't need a massive walk-in closet - I don't think many travelers do - most of us try to take only carry-on luggage so we don't have enough clothing to use a walk-in. The street noise was horrible; the room had a window air conditioner and this contributed to the high decibel level. Luckily, I had ear plugs! The water pressure in the shower was excellent; but, I never had a single washcloth; I had several bottles of hair conditioner but no shampoo; on 2 of the 4 days I never got a replacement bath mat. The staff at reception were friendly and courteous; they did their best but there was nothing they could do to improve room #409. I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a NYC visit”
Reviews.Author: robbcross
Reviews.Content: Terrific location on corner of Lexington and 39th, rooms are modern and relatively large by NYC standards. Boutique feel. Lobby is small, wifi available in the lobby. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet area”
Reviews.Author: friems
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is great for easy access to Grand Central Terminal. It's a little farther walk to Times Square about 8 blocks which is fine if the weather is good. The tree lined Park Avenue was pretty with the leaves beginning to turn. The bar area in the hotel is loud and tends to have a younger crowd with the Tuscany (the sister hotel that is right next door) having a quieter bar area. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. We ate breakfast at Blooms which was right around the corner on Lexington - less expensive and good food and service. Would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great view of Chrysler Building”
Reviews.Author: LivingJoyfully
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the suite (one bedroom and one bath, with queen fold out), and it was a great value for the weekend (around $300/night). What we didn't expect was the fact that there was no door between the bedroom and living room, so no privacy. My sister-in-law snores like a gorilla, so sleeping was challenging with no door between the two rooms. I broke a lightbulb in a pedestal lamp while trying to transfer it to the bedside lamp that had no bulb, cleaned up most of it, and thought (as one would) the cleaners would get the rest of it, but there were shards of glass left on the floor till we left three days later. On the up-side, the location is perfect: within walking distance to Grand Central, and an easy subway ride to anywhere in the city. Our room had a fabulous view of the Chrysler Building. The consierge was helpful, albiet too casual, in my opinion (shift change, and chatting amongst themselves, leaving us standing there for a good two minutes). I probably would stay here again, but would get two rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely beds, super location !”
Reviews.Author: pvdzavel
Reviews.Content: St Giles hotel has very big rooms and their beds are excellent.The view was great from our room (10th floor) The gym is perfect. The staff was very helpfull and friendly. As we had a room on Lexington it was a bit noisy. Very good location,2 minutes from central station and nice neighbourhood. They have also a good bar on lex. The quality was perfect !

Reviews.Title: “okay but could do a lot better”
Reviews.Author: Brigitte D
Reviews.Content: st Giles hotel is okay, but that positive report is mainly due to the very good location and the extremely comfortable bed and cushions. There was also a very soft lounging chair in the room, a flatscreen, and a good view of the empire state building from our window. We stayed on the 14th floor at the back, so there was no noise from the outside happily, except for the constant humming of the airco system. The room is not big but spacious enough since you hardly stay there, there is so much to see and do in NY! Min points: the room was old and all the doors and furniture were sticky to the touch. The cleaning was okay for the rest. We only breakfasted ther once, it was 15 dollar a person but not worth it. We decided to have breakfast in the nearby Pret à manger, which was a lot better. The lifts in the hotel are always noisy because of the very loud modern music in it. You can only hope you will not get stuck ther for some time.. The lobby is very dark, there is also too loud music playing,and it looks more like the entrance of a nightclub than an hotel. What bothers us also is the absolute wastefulness of replacing the towels everyday, even when you put them on the rack. What an unnecessary ecological waste of water, energy, solvents...and even money for the management. For Europeans who are used to take care of their environment, this is such a waste.

Reviews.Title: “Almost excellent”
Reviews.Author: mwamom
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights last week. 95% of the staff were helpful and very friendly; there is one gal who checks folks in who never smiles and just seems overall unfriendly or snippy. Oscar is a can-do kinda guy and is very helpful. The concierge folks are great; one of them accidentally gave me directions to a different retailer than the one I was wanting to go to~he apologized, gave us a card for 2 free drinks that we were unable to use and we found a $15 credit on our hotel bill. If you are looking to spend alot of time in Time Square and that area, it is a bit of a walk. If you don't want to be disturbed in your room during the day, keep the Quiet sign on your door and set the lock inside; I had someone walk in on me twice-he was looking for room service trays. They also need to figure out what is wrong with their card keys-they almost never work in the elevators and sometimes they stop working in your room door as well....pretty frustrating after a long day walking. I would stay there again but would hope that they can improve on the items that I mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: olinn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days in early september, greeted by warm and welcome staff and incredibly helpful lady at the helpdesk. Got a room on the 8th floor. Room was really clean and very spacious (king size), great bed, a small couch, desk and everything one would need. Bathroom was also very clean and the bath/shower was good. Maidservice was also very good, room was tidied up nicely. We didn't really stay much in the hotel, we just went out early and came in late, but we experienced almost no noise and slept through all the nights (I'm a SUPER light sleeper). Did not eat at the inhouse restaurant nor drink at the bar, but everything looked great. The hotel is in a nice walking distance from Times Square and 5th Avenue, but far enough that there isn't bustling traffic and much noise. All in all we loved our stay and would reccomend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and huge clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ChunkyLoverNo1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights and I found this an ideal location. It is approx. 3 minutes to Grand Central Station, 5 min to 5th Avenue, 10min to Macys and about 15 min to Times Square! We got the NY Airporter bus from the Airport to Grand Central and walked one block and the hotel is there. Cheap and convenient. We stayed in the basic superior room and it was huge. The bed was a large size and very comfortable. We also got plenty of space for all our stuff and a separate "room" (area behind a wall) which we used more as a walk in wardrobe. The TV is huge and has plenty of channels and the docking station also came in handy. The air conditioning is good but it can be very loud. We had to turn this off every night whilst we slept. I don't know if this would be possible during a heat wave. Its not a hotel that is brimming with facilities but thats the way I like it. The staff were always friendly and courteous and you always feel safe with the security constantly on the door. They even held our luggage for us free of charge on the final day while we went exploring. This hotel focuses on its core objective, which is its guests and the rooms. Too many hotels lose focus on having Michelin star restaurants, spas, etc. This is a great hotel for all people as its central, yet in a reasonably quiet area. I travelled for leisure but I usually travel on business. I think some business people may not be completely satisfied as the broadband is expensive and I don't think they have a business area to print, copy, etc. This hotel is very quiet though and has a good sized desk for which to work on. So this could suit some people. If you are looking for a base to explore New York I cannot recommend this place enough. Its a great mid priced hotel. The only reason it is not 5 star is because its not 5 star quality. This is a really good four star hotel and is really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: poterajko
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the St Giles. It's a lovely hotel in the heart of New York. Our room was very spacious and the bed was very comfortable. We have stayed in 3 other hotels in New York of the same rating and the St Giles is the best by far. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good three to four star tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: ks_moe
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through Hotwire and paid 250 $ a night, which is a reasonable price, considering the standard of the hotel and its location (39th and Lexington). It's close to Grand Central and within walking distance of the Empire State Building. Hotwire has given St. Giles the Court four stars, which in one way is correct, because it has the amenities of a four star hotel (room service, mini-bar, concierge, fitness center etc). In several ways however, the hotel appears as a three star hotel (small and dark lobby, somewhat worn rooms and informal service). Anyway, the hotel is a great choice for those seeking a good and reasonably priced hotel in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “better than previous stays”
Reviews.Author: RossfromCLT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St Giles Court in early September because it was the cheapest ($450 a night) room I could find around Grand Central. My previous stays had at been uneventful and unimpressive but this trip was signifiantly better. I stayed in room 719, which was not nearly as cramped as the smaller, basic rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Holy Moley, The Saint Giles Is Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: shreiby
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the St. Giles- The Court. The hotel is an easy walk from Grand Central, which provides subway access to all areas of the city. Check-in was fast and easy. We arrived at the hotel about 11:00 a.m. and were able to get right into our room. Another nice touch was that the clerk at the front desk asked us if we wanted a room with a view or a room that was quiet. She mentioned that the rooms with views are near the street and there is oftentimes noise. We chose a quiet room since we were going to be seeing plenty of the city and didn’t need a good view. The room was a pretty decent size. We had a king size bed and had enough room to maneuver without falling over one another. The bathroom was quite spacious, making it easy to get ready each day. The air conditioner is not necessarily noisy, but it does seem to always run. It didn’t cause any disruption to our sleep. The bed was comfortable and we slept well. We had breakfast in the restaurant on our last morning and the pancakes were probably about the best I’ve had. We had drinks one night in the Lex Bar and I was impressed that it attracted a local crowd, instead of just guests at the hotel. Overall, the hotel delivered on service and quality. It deserves 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, but away from the action”
Reviews.Author: Sorchap
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights with husband and son. Had one bedroomed suite which was very spacious. No problems with cleanliness and I thought the bathroom was adequate. Bed was very comfortable, however, they didn't make up the sofa bed in the livingroom and we had to ring down looking for bed linen. The lobby area was very small and impersonal it didn't encourage you to linger. The main problem for us was that you are not in the centre of things, we had trouble finding somewhere to eat one night at about 10pm, I feel this wouldn't have happened near Time Square. Having said that, our room was very quiet so that was a bonus. Scottys Diner nearby was brilliant for an authentic american breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: Petitbeer
Reviews.Content: I spent many hours researching hotels in New York to find a great four star hotel that was in a good location but reasonably priced, it wasn't an easy feat but thought I had found it in the St. Giles. However, I was left thinking it was "just alright" but nothing to write home about, although I am writing to Trip Advisors about it! I agree with a lot of the reviewers here that it is looking a little tired, expecially the bathrooms. I normally don't pick a hotel if I can't see a photo of the bathroom as I am quite particular about the style but because the bedrooms looked like they fulfilled the boutique look I prefer and the reviews were on the whole positive I took a punt. Whilst the bathrooms were clean, I cannot fault them on that, they definitely need updating and the drainage was very poor. Every time I had a shower I found myself ankle deep in water and it took a long time for the water to drain away after I had finished with it. The bath also has a shower curtain, something I hate and I think by 2011 baths with showers should certainly have a shower screen or even just do away with the bath and have a walk in shower instead; the curtain was at least clean. The bedroom was a good size, bed slightly larger than a King and comfy. The room also had a sofa and large table (not sure if that is standard or not but we booked a standard room). There was a mini bar that was good for chilling our water and duty free wine. The maid service was very good though. The air conditioning was effective but noisy so a good tip is to leave it on whilst you are out of the room to keep it cool and then turn it off when you are asleep. We were on a floor that was quite high up so no complaints about the traffic, so can't comment on the level of noise lower down and we could see the Empire State Building from our window. The staff were friendly, although we didn't need to bother them too much. The concierge was helpful and booked a trip for us without any problems, although she neglected to tell us what time we had to turn up at the location, luckily the British way of turning up early paid off or we would have missed it! The communal areas were a little dark which wouldn't have been a problem had the decor not also needed a facelift, the dimmed lights couldn't hide that. As for wifi, no there isn't any but that really wasn't an issue for me as I liked having a break from the internet for a week. Overall the hotel is ok but I would say more of a 3* than a 4*, if you go with that attitude then I don't think you will be disappointed. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “The bed is sooooo comfy.”
Reviews.Author: Suzyd1964
Reviews.Content: A hip hotel at an affordable price in a terrific Manhattan location. I travel a lot and rarely find a bed that meets my standards. This king size bed had a fantastic mattress, nice pillows and luxurious sheets. Size of room was impressive. I was disappointed my bathroom only had a shower - and the seal around the door needed fixing - as I would have a mini flood after every use. Doorman was great. Concierge, unfortunately, couldn't give us direction. Not quite sure why they can't jump onto Mapquest and print out directions. Price of internet was high and there is no comfortable lobby space to sit for any considerable amount of time to use wifi. There was also no desk in the room. Bar/Lounge was a happening place at night! Overall very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Sarah M
Reviews.Content: We stayed from the 10-13th August. Booked this based on the web reviews and thought the pics looked quite modern. To be honest, this exceeded my expectations. We stayed in one of the suites, the lounge room was huge and all amenities very modern. The king sized bed was one of the best beds we have slept on and the pillows were like clouds. Thought the location was quite good, as walking distance to Grand Central and not that far to Times Square. We were checked in by Danny, who was fantastic and also found the concierge (dont know her name), to be very helpful. I would def stay here again and will recommend this to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: flipflops49
Reviews.Content: We asked for a quiet room but I wouldn't consider what we got as being 'quiet'. The aircon was very noisy, even when switched off! The room was big, the bed was comfy and the bathroom was ok but the bath had drainage issues. The bathroom amenities were never replaced and some days we got no bath mat and a few towels, other days a bath mat and lots of towels. There is a $15 per day charge for wi-fi which is ridiculous in this day and age, although there is free wi-fi available in the teeny tiny lobby (or the nearby Starbucks). The mini bar and room service prices were outrageous and no complimentary water was provided. Tea and coffee making facilities were also absent. With a few small touches, such as water, tea/coffee and free wi-fi, this hotel would be more tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Best bargain in midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: macalif0rnia
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is a former W hotel and retains all the flourishes one finds in the W chain, including all of the charm and some of the former staff. It is very conveniently located in the quaint and safe Murray Hill section of Manhattan between Park and Lexington avenues, three blocks south of Grand Central Station. The theater district, Times Square, the UN, great restaurants and the hub of the business world are all within walking distance. One of the best aspects: the rates are amazingly affordable by NY standards -- US $220/night. A sister hotel, The Tuscany, also a former W hotel, is next door. The rooms at both hotels are large, by NY standards, tasteful and comfortable. Truly one of the great "finds" in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was nice but the ice”
Reviews.Author: dsb2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a weekend trip to the city to see plays and visit museums. It's a convenient location from Grand Central Station, and the theater district isn't too far a walk. We had asked for a room on a high floor away from the elevator and were upgraded to a nice room on the top floor. Our room was quite spacious, and the bed was comfortable. We even had a view of the Empire State building out of our window. Our only complaints were minor ones. One of the light switches next to the door didn't seem connected to any of the lights. And since there are no ice machines on the guest floors, you need to call room service and ask them to deliver a bucket of ice. On our first night, it took over 30 minutes for the ice to get delivered to our room. On the second floor, we requested ice again. After an hour had passed, with no sign of any ice, I called to request the ice again, and was told that someone had knocked on our door with the ice and no one had answered. This was an outright lie, since there is no way neither one of us would have failed to have heard a knock on the door. A short while later, the ice finally arrived. The elevators never took long to arrive, but they're small and would be problematic for someone with claustrophobia. And the wireless internet is not free, but a bit pricey. If you want to use the fitness center, you must go to the sister hotel next door. Even so, we would certainly stay hear again if we could get a decent rate like we did for this weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly loved it”
Reviews.Author: wleuven
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, nice staff. The rooms were big and clean. location was great , near empire state building. We booked a normal size room but got much more in my opinion , a regular suite. we 'll be back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay few days”
Reviews.Author: xCinnd
Reviews.Content: I stayed there three days, and it was very ok. The team is very VERY nice, I insist onthis point because it's the better point of this hotel is the employees. The room was very big, but this could be more clean. There is wifi only in the lobby, this is ok, but this could be more useful if there was more places to sit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Rosie53
Reviews.Content: You might think that this hotel is a bit out of the way when it comes to parts of New York. But you would actually be mistaken. My husband and I stayed her and walked everywhere. If we saw a show in the evening, we walked along 42nd st (which is now lovely and safe) east to 3rd avenue and just people watched as we went along. It was lovely. If you are not partial to walking you can take buses (M42 crosstown, M101 uptown or downtown). You are very close to Grand Central Station which has a lovely undergound gourmet market. Fun to visit. If you need anything in the way of incidentals, there are plenty of Duane Reade pharmacies in the area. As far as the hotel, it is a boutique hotel, very European and quite nice. Very clean and modern. Nice ground level lounge if you want an evening drink after a day of sightseeing. I highly recommend this location for something different. I love the East Side of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great value choice, excellent location and price”
Reviews.Author: Lou_Mike
Reviews.Content: This was our base for a 4 night trip. Great midtown location close to Grand Central and Empire State building. We liked our room - not huge but very comfy bed, nice chaise longue and good closet space. Bathroom was small and probably the most tired part of the room but it was very clean and perfectly adequate and it was nice to have natural light in a hotel bathroom for once. We did have a view of the Empire State building from our bedroom window which was a plus. Staff were friendly and helpful. We didn't use any of the public areas as we were out and about so much. Best meal of our visit was at the Benjamin Steak House attached to the Dylan Hotel - just a few blocks up from the St Giles. Absolutely outstanding steak and wonderful service in a very nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: vikingchick
Reviews.Content: Apart from the size of the rooms (huge), everything at this hotel was mediocre. We will spend our money elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Sri8
Reviews.Content: Spacious room with all required facilities. Close to Grand Central Station, Subway, fifth avenue and all other parts of Manhattan. Will be a good option for family as well. Good breakfast. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: aliwishes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! really close to grand central station and access to all the subway lines! lots of food and shops nearby to buy water, snacks, etc. The room was also huge for a NYC hotel. Clean modern rooms and bathroom. I would definitely stay here again! Also check out aroma cafe near by for their croissants and coffee! The service was excellent as well. They let us check in super early and check our luggage the day we left!

Reviews.Title: “Was perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Dunn
Reviews.Content: If you are on a sight-seeting break then you can do no wrong with this place. As everyone says the rooms are genorus in size with a lovely Chaise-lounge, big TV (all the channels you will need) and the minbar and wardrobe tucked away in an alcove, further helping with the feeling of space. There is also an ironing board/iron which is always so useful. The bathroom is not luxurious, as a little tired and basic, but again good size with nice white robs, towels and toliteries.
