We had a problem with a slow draining/leaking sink which they fixed immediately. The bed is GREAT - slept better than did at home. Air-con is noisy, like sleeping in a plane. And as it was 40 degress (100f), we had no choice but to keep it on all the time. But luckily so tired each night it didn't keep us awake. The bar downstairs is great, funky and quite a hot-spot it seems. At reception they had a nice touch of putting out little cakes on a daily basis. Guys on the door are lovely. Location is excellant.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: meestar
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to attract more international travelers, but we Californians were very comfortable here. A nice sized room, which was remarkably quiet for NYC; we faced a courtyard, not a street, and we'd suggest you ask for that. Easy to get everywhere on foot or otherwise. Room was clean, well-looked after,and staff was very very helpful. We had arrrived very late and tired, and the man who helped us with our bags went out of his way to be sure we were comfortable; the first room he took us to was noisy, and on his own, he got us that quieter room.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again...”
Reviews.Author: Chris_23_11
Reviews.Content: first thought was the room was a bit worn, but it was clean and huge, by NYC standards. it used to be a W Hotel property, so the Heavenly Beds are amazing. Pillows too. very hip/modern, wide range of guests - everyone welcome. gym next door at the tuscany was fantastic. hotel staff was very friendly. 3 blocks south of grand central station, walking distance to byrant park, and good restaurants. big market 2 blocks away. would definately stay here again. great value for NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: MarynellL
Reviews.Content: Clean, looks recently renovated. Friendly staff (although the concierge was a bit testy at times). Excellent service. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, we will definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: black42
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the St Giles the Court. We had a very trendy and spacious room, much more space than other hotels we have stayed in at similar price. There's no fuzz checking in or if you have a question: always friendly service, to the point. The location is superb, so close to Central Station, Bryant Park and nice restaurants around. The bar is also a must: supertrendy, delicious appetizers.

Reviews.Title: “great value,great service”
Reviews.Author: albert2913
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived ,with the doorman opening the door, to the service on the desk by Sarah in particular and being shown to our very nice room ,everything was perfect.The position of the "Court" on the corner of 39th & Lexington and only 2 blocks from Central station also handy to cafes,delis,restaurants and bars suited us personally.The desk staff were great organizing best times etc.for Empire State and Ellis Island tours in particular.The room was clean and well serviced in the 10 days we stayed there and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: lgitterman
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on quikbook who listed this as a luxury property. Not! Hallways very dark and the air conditioner was so noisy that we changed rooms at 1:30 a.m! Service was great and they were very nice but this hotel is a bit schizophrenic - fairly modern with nice linens but the heater in the bathroom was hanging off the wall, the light switches had been painted over and the room was very dark, despite two windows in what they called the "executive corner suite".

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: VirginieVH
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Court for 4 nights. We had a really nice contemporary room at the street side on the 10th floor. It was bigger than I had expected it to be, according to NYC standards. The room was clean and there were really comfy beds! There was a little bathroom with a toilet, a sink and a shower in the bathtub. I would have appreciated a seperate toilet and some more storage in the bathroom. Towels were replaced daily and there were plenty of them. There was a safe-deposit box and a minibar where we stored some drinks of our own, after we discovered that a bottle of Fiji-water cost us over $7! The airconditioning worked really well. We could hear the traffic on the streets, but hey, well we were in NYC, the city that never sleeps... The staff were really friendly. We asked them for some recommendations for a good steakhouse in the neighborhood. They recommended 'Benjamin Steakhouse' and they were happy to make a reservation for us. They also advised us taking the Newark/Manhattan bus (at 41st St) to go to the airport instead of a shuttle bus. This bus comes every 15 minutes and costs $15 for a single ride. Good advise! There is a bar at the 1st floor next to the lobby, with a pool table. We unfortunately did not get to see much of it, as we were to tired from exploring the city the whole day! One morning we had breakfast at Audrey's, which is only a few steps from the hotel, in 39th St. It sits actually in the hotel next door The Tuscany. You can take want you want, buffetstyle. The food was great. You can put the check on your hotel room, even if you stay in The Court. Overall a great experience! We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “More than expected! Amazing birthday weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Sofia_Fatale
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and the from desk day staff is great! They upgraded me from a standard to a one bedroom suite for my birthday! The suite has a private step out balcony with a table and two chairs - very romantic! The bed is SO COMFY and clean! NO BEDBUGS - I always check thoroughly! The AC blows strong cold air and there is an iPhone/iPod hookup in the room for louder speakers. The bathroom did not have a fan NPR could I open the windows so it does get steamy quick! It's kind of hard to hail a cab because of it's proximity to Grand Central Station but walking up a few blocks helps. Nice convenient store on the corner, and the view at night of stars mingling with the skyscrapers makes for a great romantic evening while drinking chilled wine with your love! I will be back here, definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Real New York Ambience”
Reviews.Author: travelingon14
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights here in mid May. Upon arrival the lobby may be slightly disconcerting for travelers who are used to traditional lodging experiences. It was small, dark, and trendy with an edgy big-city feel. But we just went with it since we were visiting the biggest city of them all! Check-in was quick and easy. Elevators and hallways matched the lobby in style, lighting, etc. I had the courtyard view room and my friend had the regular double room. The only real difference we noticed was in square footage. The courtyard view room has a small entryway and the bedroom was only slightly larger than the regular room. For the difference in price, go with the regular double room. Beds were comfy and linens were very nice. A velvet covered chaise and chair were a nice touch but there were some stains on the chaise. I avoided sitting there! Bathroom is very basic and offers no plush amenities other than a nice terrycloth robe. However the shower was great, towels were plentiful, and all was kept very clean. Carpet seemed clean and well maintained. Houskeeping does a great job here. A small fridge is handy for keeping water, left over cheesecake, etc. :) Beware the well stocked mini bar unless you are prepared to pay the high price. Now a word about non-room details. Front desk personnel were helpful, actually much more helpful than the concierge. We got several tips on cabs, subway trains, restaurants, etc. from them. The location of this hotel is fairly good. It is very near Grand Central terminal and is in a nice quiet neighborhood (Murray Hill). The walk to Times Square is probably about a mile or an $8.00 cab ride. We took the subway often and walked for miles over the 4 days we were in the city. If you want Chinese try Mapu Tofu across the street from the hotel ( tip from the desk clerk). There's a little place on Lexington just a couple blocks down from the hotel that's great for breakfast or walk a little further to Penelope's for breakfast or lunch. Try this hotel if you want a true NY experience. We would stay again or we might try the sister property, The Tuscany, which is next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge room”
Reviews.Author: porkchop1496
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we found a deal putting it under $200/night in Manhattan, it had decent reviews and also no bedbugs on the bedbug registry. We are so glad we stayed here. It was a great location for LaGuardia and also near Grand Central and within walking distance of lots of places we wanted to go. Lots of restaurants nearby. We stayed on the 39th Street side, 9th floor and it was quiet at night and we had a view of the Chrysler tower. The room was huge (bigger than some of my friends' studios in NYC), the bathroom is on the window side and there is a little section near the door with a closet and mini-bar. I wouldn't touch the minibar food or order from the hotel menu because it was super expensive--$9.50 for a pot of coffee! We got 2 free glasses of wine at the bar Lex which was very nice. The room was fairly clean, it could use some updates but it was comfortable. The carpet had some stains and the light switches are grubby. The sink and bath drained slowly as if there was a clog but eventually all water went down. The shower wasn't as pleasant as it could have been because you stood in a puddle. There were some stray hairs on the windowsill when we arrived. The A/C worked great and the bed was comfy. Housekeeping only provided us with one tiny bar of soap but after calling they immediately brought up more. The reception/door people were cordial while housekeeping was actually more friendly with greetings. One woman basically grunted at me at the front desk to tell me yes, I could leave my luggage in the closet. She was not exactly wearing her hospitality hat then but at least I was acknowledged and answered--I'll take that.

Reviews.Title: “ok in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: Nancy2005
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after a fair amount of research during a busy week in NY. My colleague and I were each upgraded to a suite. I had three closets. Such luxury for an 18 hour stay. You really can have too much space. I was careful not to unpack beyond a careful range or I surely would have left things behind. Bathroom not great but passable. Great views of garden terraces in the neighborhood around. I thought it way overpriced, but nothing better or less expensive was available. Comfortable enough and staff ok. Excellent location to Grand Central which was one of my objectives.

Reviews.Title: “This is a hotel for out of towners, for the bridge and tunnel crowd.”
Reviews.Author: barbaraGeneva
Reviews.Content: Awful reception though we were upgraded to a suite--at the sister hotel. No apology from desk clerk that we had to go back out in the pouring rain to check in. No lobby to speak of. Blaring loud music from bar off check-in area. The suite had a large living room, decor was recent and red velveteen slipcovers had been added to furniture. The furniture itself was cheap and not aging well. The bed was not a king sized (which we had reserved), and the bedding itself was so soft it was impossible to sleep--our backs hurt. The bathroom was from the 1950s. We booked the hotel unseen (mystery hotel) on quikbook so we got a very very good price. I would have been furious if we had paid more.

Reviews.Title: “Dont want to leave”
Reviews.Author: zekimus
Reviews.Content: I think i was upgraded i have a huuuge room that i could live in. Great location and service. Booked on hotwire. I love the street noise. I love nyc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice sized rooms.”
Reviews.Author: bsr2169
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2nd till 6th May, hotel is very conveniently located, close to empire state building which was the view from our room, grand central station, 5th ave, times sq all are within walking distance. The rooms are a very nice size, decor is clean and compact. All the staff where very friendly and always willing to help with any queries. The price for the room for the location and service was brilliant. Excellent hotel for visiting and sightseeing..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: beejalshah
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great. Room service was very expensive but then there was a great diner round the corner from the hotel so no big deal. Conscierge service was great. Would highly recommend this hotel and I would be happy to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Just OKAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: consumer-analyst
Reviews.Content: I really am amused by these various five star analyses of mediocre places to stay in NYC. Once again, I see raving reviews of a hotel that honestly is no more than a solid three star hotel. It has a lot of room but so what! The carpet is beat, in the room and the hallway, lights are low cause there ain't anything bright to be found and the bathrooms need to be ripped up and upgraded. Now I paid $285 as most hotels of this supposed 4 star ilk were charging 400 and up. So I took a chance and all I can say is it was just okay. Room service on the slow slide with not great food or food selection. Overall, it was decently clean but with the low lights and everything dark, it is hard to tell. Let me finish by saying it looked like it needed to be upgraded about 3 years ago but not totally repulsive. I am sure when they last gave the hotel a go-over in 1999 or so, it was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel! .. Great Staff and mid-town location the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: BigBear1956
Reviews.Content: Wanted to thank the entire staff for a great stay. The room was very comfortable .. the staff very hospitable. I appologize for not remembering names of everone but a young and helpful fellow at the door (Tony?) .. . and a very helpful and sweet young lady at reception (English/Australian accent?) absolutely fantastic. Mid-town location was perfect .. a few blocks in any direction and we were where we wanted to be. Great bar downstairs. We look forward to coming back in a few months. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Trying a bit too hard?”
Reviews.Author: mbiz
Reviews.Content: Found myself here on a 'secret offer' deal and the price was right. Nice Murray Hill hotel, 3 blocks from Grand Central station. Easy & friendly check-in. Rooms are spacious. Bathrooms need to be updated. Carpet in my room was sticky. Internet could not be made to work for hours and is expensive. The bar downstairs is unbelievably loud and in general the hotel tries a bit too hard to be cool...

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: SUEYF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at St Giles for 4 nights booked through Quikbook.com secret sale for $145 a night so was good value. Check in was very easy with Jessica at front desk (She is much friendlier than other girl) We got a room on the 11th floor facing the crysler building. Room was smaller than expected but ok, big desk, double bed, chaise long longue, small bathroom with shower/bath, a wardrobe with safe and tv/dvd/ipod docker. Room is dated but still comfortable. Hotel is about a 5 minute walk from Grand Central and 15 mins from times Square. Free wifi in the lobby and is charged in the room but i managed to find a wifi connection in our room (look for the linksy connection) Not sure i would stay here again, purely because I think i would prefer something more central but definately good value

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff and good value”
Reviews.Author: SkyDK
Reviews.Content: The up sides: Good hotel at a good location. Friendly staff - excellent service. Decent size rooms. good beds. Large closets. Large flat screen TV + dvd/VHS. Efficient Wifi free in lobby - at a fair price in room. Some rooms have iPod/iPhone docks and radio connection (did only play at full trottle with my iPhone 4 - so it was at no use). Nice decor and furnitures. Working table. The down sides: Some rooms towrds Lexington AV. and at low fllors are very noisy. We had to ask to be moved around the corner to 39st - much quieter. The aircon and heating sytem is very old and noisy and in crappy condition. The built in closets have seen better days. Turning on the lights at the beds was a scientific experiment every time. Lobby dominated by the LOUD music from the LEX bar adjoining. Rooms could need 2 good chairs as there is space enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money mid-town location”
Reviews.Author: ju-ju60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with our friends from Dallas. We booked through Expedia and for the price we paid we were very pleased with hotel and our room on the top floor. We had a direct view of the Empire State Building(when it wasn't shrouded in mist!)and plenty of space although the bathroom was quite small and lacked space to put our toilet bags etc which was a little annoying. Shower was good though and there always seemed to be plenty of hot water. Everywhere was clean and the bed was comfortable. The furniture and carpeting were looking a little tired but that didn't particularly bother us. The biggest problem would probably have been the exceptionally noisy air conditioning/heating but we found we didn't need it at night. If you were there in the summer I don't think there would be any chance of sleeping! Was the same in our friends room on the 4th floor. The location was good in our opinion. Very close to Grand Central Station and the Rockerfeller Center. The bar at the hotel was fairly "buzzy" but we found the music a little loud for easy conversation in a large group. Maybe it's just my age?? Didn't use the gym in the sister hotel next door or visit the restaurant so can't comment although our friends thought the gym to be good. The staff was friendly and pretty helpful although on check-out they tried to charge us for a movie and when we queried this the girl was most ungracious. I'm sure people "try it on" with in room charges but quite frankly it soured the end of our stay just a tad. I would stay here again depending on the time of year.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: russtoff
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Great location. Bed was VERY comfortable. Clean room. Soft towels. We will DEFINITELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Classic New York Hotel, Really great service starting at checkin with Aamira.”
Reviews.Author: ecc1952
Reviews.Content: I felt like a friend coming back, although I had never stayed at the St. Giles. Aamira greeted us at the front desk, had our rooms ready, was really friendly and made us feel welcome. I was traveling with 4 colleagues and everyone had a great stay. They were very helpful with dinner recommendations and Barbara made the reservations for us. The room was great with all the amenities needed. Aamira made check out easy and helped us with taxis and directions. All in all a great stay - someplace I didn't know of but will definitely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home!!!”
Reviews.Author: escapetostyle
Reviews.Content: Make reservations online -look for specials deals or promotions

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not bad hotel but needs some cosmetics.”
Reviews.Author: Tikiniki83
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were given a room on the 14th floor. Our keys wouldn't work in the door, so we went back to front desk and they fixed the keys. When we opened the door, we noticed someone else's stuff all over the room. I called front desk and told them it looked like someone else was staying in this room. Back down we went and turns out she reversed the numbers. Umm, oops. Checked into correct room and found it to be nice but a little worn and tired. Needs a new paint job and some new carpet. Also, it would be recommended to at least remove the 'W' hotel stickers from the mini fridge. (Previous owners of this hotel.) However, the room was clean and comfortable, so it was average in my book. Not sure if it was quite worth the price, but it is NY. The only other issue was that on the last day of a 5 day stay our room cards wouldn't work. Since my spouse was out, I went to front desk. Since reservation was in his name, they wouldn't reactivate my card even though we had been there 5 days and the room was already paid for. The guy made me call my boyfriend so he could ask what card was used for the room. The answer was VISA. This is the verification he needed? WOW. He had a real attitude and made some comment about the law...I wanted to mention how easily THEY had let us into someone else's room already.... Location was decent. Very close to Grand Central station and subways and we had a partial view of the Empire State building. I am not one to complain and as I previously said, the room was okay. It was the actions of the staff that gave me more of a negative opinion of the hotel. Oh and internet in the room is $16.95 a day. Outrageous. It is free in the lobby if you want to sit there...they did print my boarding pass free of charge. So, even though there were some downsides, overall it was a decent stay. In the future, I would probably look for another hotel that was a little nicer, but would I stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GalIsrael
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night during business trip on March 16. Pros: I was upgraded to a huge suite. Cons: I was charged $7 for accepting a fedex package delivered to me. Half broken locks on the room's dor. Poor bathtub drainage Metal soap tray fell off the wall while I was taking a shower. Poor shower head. Room has an old rundown smell Chipped furniture. Very noisy A/C.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish hotel with helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: WndrLst_11
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at St Giles the Court in Manhattan! The staff was so kind. My husband and I were able to secure an early check-in so that we could freshen up before seeing the sites. Aamira gave us a beautiful room and was so friendly to us that we felt very comfortable. My husband ordered room service and the service was prompt. The concierge helped us find a very nice restaurant last minute before seeing Wicked. All in all, great hotel, great service! Oh, and very comfortable mattress!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VALover4
Reviews.Content: We went to the Court for one night to redeem our Living Social deal. We were greeted by a very nice front desk clerk (Sarah), who upgraded us to a suite. The suite was one of the biggest places I have ever seen in Manhattan. It had a nice-sized front coat closet, a deep-set refreshment bar, a massive living room with what must have been a 46" television, a massive master bedroom with a 30" television and large closet, and a large bathroom with full-sized tub and nice bath products. We also had an insane view of the Empire State Building from our chaise lounge! We liked it so much that right before checkout, my wife and I called down and booked a second night. The bed was extremely comfortable, the hallways were quiet, and above all, the room was very clean. I immediately invited my friends, who live in Manhattan and whom we were visiting, over when we arrived since we knew that our hotel room would be a welcome respite as compared to their apartments in the city. We're definitely going to come back.

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CanindianPartyGirl
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 4-day debauchery trip with 4 girlfriends in NYC, from Toronto. We were quite happy with the St. Giles - especially relative to other hotels we've had in NYC. Initially, we picked it on account of location and that it was one of the few spots which didn't show up on the bedbug registry. (Ick.) I'd read other reviews about the nice doormen, etc. But, seriously..the staff was fantastic - and it really makes a difference to your stay. The doormen were always friendly - and funny. The concierge was really helpful - especially when it counted. My sister misplaced her wedding band in our friends' room who'd already checked out - they were great about escorting us into the room, and helping to find the ring. (Which we did!)..and upon my return, I realized in all of that panic, I left my wallet in my own room. They found it and are sending it by courier immediately. They also had cupcakes and tea in the lobby from time to time (adorable). There was one girl with a slight attitude...but, she's young...she'll learn. The hotel has a great bar that seemed busy every night between Thurs-Saturday, called The Lex. We had a few drinks there, and were happy with everything. Good music... As far as the rooms go - they are big for NYC. And the beds are fantastic. Huge pillows (4 per bed) ...duvet covers, that must get washed frequently. It was very clean, and easy to sleep in. I wouldn't be able to lounge in the chairs in the rooms - they seemed dated, and I'm a bit of a germaphobe. But, at least they're good for tossing shopping bags on. Our room was a corner one with a huge walk-in closet with a dresser inside. There was an abundance of towels and robes in the room. Good black-out window coverings. My few "do betters" would be: -The hotel turns the heat off at night (I guess they start to do this in March?) I guess it's controlled through a central boiler, so we had to call and ask for the heat to be put on the first night, and again first morning. - The carpet wasn't lifting in our room, but was threatening to, and really needs to be changed - The bathroom was fine for NY, but could do with an upgrade - especially the tub. But, there was always hot water..there's a rain shower (it just doesn't have much pressure). And our tub wasn't draining well, but they sent someone to fix that with apologies right away. - The room doors are thin...the hallway traffic gets noisy I'd definitely stay here again - the location was fabulous. Curious about The Tuscany (the higher price-point of the two properties).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterFrmDxb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights in Feb 2011 and got an excellent deal from Booking.com. Good things about the hotel were its central location (on 39th between Lex and Park) with 15 minute walk to Times Square and 10 minute to central shopping area on 5th and 6th Ave. Breakfast was included at Audrey Cafe in the next door sister property. We had the courtyard king room which was massive for a NYC hotel, however, they could have used some of that space for a larger bathroom which was quite tiny. Staff was courteous but cold i.e. lacked the welcoming warmth. Also they should provide Free Wi-Fi in the room which is a fairly standard in most similar hotel nowadays. Given its location and convinience and assuming the same price, I'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: dctraveler1024
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel part of a living social deal and I am so glad we found it. We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The rooms are spacious and are very clean. We where given a very warm greeting by the front desk. Then after we checked in they even called to make sure everything was up to our standards. They where very helpful when we asked for directions or a resturaunt recommendation. The location to Grand Central is nice and its just one subway stop from times square! The bathroom is small but its NYC so that didn't suprise me it was very well kept and that was what was important to me. We also had a GREAT view from our room. I loved sitting on the chase lounge looking out at the buildings. The bed was also extremley comforable I could have slept for days. I do wisht he closet area had more lighting as I would have done my make up in their (their is a nice counter where the mini bar is set up) We had no issues with our HVAC unit as others reported. All of our fixtures worked the night stands could use to be replaced to add a little more modern touch but they where in fine condition and not broken. We went to Lex bar both Friday/Saturday night at the end of our evening the bartenders gave us great service. We did not eat at the hotel but locally hit up the Bagels and More and one late night stopped at Scotty's diner. We had dinner near Times Square with friends on Friday and at a great italian place on 42 before our show. Overall we where very pleased and happy with our stay. We had a very clean room. We where treated very nicely by the staff and for us the location was perfect. Off the beaten path a little bit but for us its just what we wanted. Its a great hotel! Next time we are in NYC we plan on returning even without our discount.

Reviews.Title: “An "ok" option”
Reviews.Author: Bohemia123
Reviews.Content: I stay in NYC frequently for business, but this past weekend I stayed at St. Giles Court because we had a deal from Living Social. My review is based on the several other hotels I have stayed at in the city. Plus: The room is abnormally huge for NYC standards The location is "fairly" convenient. Especially getting there - it's literally 3 blocks from Grand Central Station. The staff was friendly and they were reasonably accommodating. The rooms were clean. The price was fair - with the living social discount. Negative: The rooms / the decor was not well kept. There was definitely some "handyman" special going on. The room service was the WORST I have ever had in NYC. And notably, the highest priced (and I have stayed at Morgan's, Kimpton, W). It was literally $80 for eggs that would have been tastier from McDonalds. The neighborhood is in a business district, you have to get on the subway to get to the sights. There is not a ton of super dining options on the weekend within a block or so. The downstairs there is a bar on Saturdays. I am guessing this is supposed to be a draw or something - but here's a hint - go to a real club - you are in NYC. We got approved for late checkout but after coming back from our run in Central Park - our room key expired. Leaving us sweaty in the hallway. When security finally came up to get us in our room - we literally had no time to shower before we had to depart. So it was a stinky train ride back. So in short, if you want a clean place - doesn't have bed bugs and is reasonably convenient - stay here. The price without the Living Social Discount might not justify it. There are some other amazing options in this price point (Hotel Roger Williams, The Royalton) which are far better then this one. So I recommend, but you probably can do better.

Reviews.Title: “needs work!”
Reviews.Author: Zebtee
Reviews.Content: stayed one night and thought we'd take a flyer on this less expensive option. We won't be back. We were upgraded to a suite, which was nice and the rooms ARE spacious, as reported here, compared to other NYC hotels. But....carpet was very worn and pulling up in several locations. We were surpised to see no curtains on any of the windows, just darkening shades. The heating system was old, took a long time to warm the room and made hissing and knocking noises at various times through the night. The wire soap holder was broken and much of the furniture was nicked and dinged. In many spots they just threw a coat of paint on the old walls and it just doesn't work. It's just old and worn and badly in need of both systems and cosmetic upgrades. If you're looking for inexpensive, this may not be bad. If you're desirious of a "decent" room, spend a little more money and you'll get a much better hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: luckik30
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite lovely and spacious as far as New York City hotels go. Located on the East side of the city it's a bit far removed from public transportation but not impossibly so. My boyfriend and I only stayed here for one night but would definitely stay here again and for longer if we could. Everyone on the staff is friendly, attentive and nice (although the concierge didn't fit the bill and seemed a bit perturbed each time we approached with questions). There is an extra step as far as security is concerned that is appreciated but can also make traveling in the elevator a bit of a chore. The decor is tasteful and modern. We stayed in a king deluxe room and were pleasantly surprised by the space and setup. The bed is very comfortable and the bathroom is clean (we were a bit disappointed by the lack of bar soap though). There is a plush armchair by the window and a chair at the desk which makes seating comfortable. We ordered breakfast from room service and were greeted with a delicious tray quite promptly and graciously. The spread was delicious and reasonably priced. The only complaint we have is about the heating system. We probably should have called the front desk but chose not to. The thermostat never registered the room's correct temperature (never rose above 69) and the heating ducts blew out semi-warm air all night. Other than that it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely and delightful respite in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: mjm7
Reviews.Content: My husband, I and two 21-yr-olds spent four nights in a junior suite at the St Giles Court at the holidays and it was wonderful and HUGE. Tastefully furnished, great bathroom toiletries, and FABULOUS views from our bedroom windows of the towering Chrysler Building in one direction and the East River-in-the-distance out another. Small walk-in nook of a closet area that allowed you dress in privacy while others were in and out of the room. Staff couldn't have been more helpful and everyday fresh apples in the lobby along with something surprising to drink ( fruit-spiked water, cider, hot tea) in the evenings. A hopping lounge is attached to the lobby (which we didn't visit when hoppin'!) and the location was terrific---within blocks of Grand Central Station. The fitness & business centers were two doors up in their companion hotel the Tuscany. Though I missed having a microwave and the bathrooms could use some updating they were perfectly adequate and our stay was delightful. We're going back!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel with spacious rooms and super cool touches!”
Reviews.Author: txroadrunner838
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in mid February. I was incredibly impressed by the size of the room (especially considering that it is in the heart of Manhattan) and the special touches (Bang and Olufsen electronics etc). Def would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: smalltowngirl48
Reviews.Content: Huge room compared to other NY hotels, comfortable beds, AC worked well and not overly loud. Great location and fantastic front desk staff. I have worked at hotels before and their customer service is exactly where it should be! :) Only complaint is that internet is way to expensive but it is still comparable to other hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: ruthannbeloved
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the St. Giles for 2 nights in December, 2010-the week before christmas and the crazy snow! We had an amazing time and this hotel is simply beautiful. It is about 2 blocks away from Grand Central, so it made it super easy to jump on the subway and get to wherever we needed to go, and also just as easy to come back and relax in our room. There are lots of good restaurants nearby as well, and lots of shopping is just over 2 streets away. Our room was impressive, we stayed up high and had a beautiful view of the empire state bldg. It was GORGEOUS. Room was way bigger then I expected, and so was the bathroom. In fact, the space in the bathroom was almost excessive (no complaints though!) Great ammenities and the staff was accomodating and friendly, even after we checked out. They held our bags for us even we we got there early to check in, and even after we checked out but were waiting to go to the airport. I would recommend this hotel to anyone for the location and the quality. We got an excellent rate online as well, very good considering it was the week pre-christmas. All in all- GO AND STAY AT THE ST. GILES COURT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: sillybillyteely
Reviews.Content: I really did NOT like this hotel at all. The location is very inconvenient, its too far east. The Hotel personnel were not nice at all. The front desk ladies were very rude, and I had a nightmare experience checking in. They claimed my credit card was bad, and it had a $0 balance, so how could it not work? She blamed me, and told me I would have to pay the room in cash. I refused, so she ran it again for the correct amount of the room, and of course, it worked. For a $428 room charge, she was trying to run it for thousands of dollars, and claimed it was for the incidentals. I told her I never had incidentals as I never partake in the bar nor the cheap food, and she laughed. When checking out, I wanted them to hold my luggage and the doorman said to me: "Oh you better watch out, I might steal your new leather coat" (I had purchased a very nice leather jacket), so I said, no thanks, I'll just carry my leather jacket with me. He then laughed at me. I walked over to the bar area, and there was a homeless man asleep on the sofa. I was also waiting in line to retrieve my stored luggage and a drunk man walked in the front door and harrassed all of the women sitting the lobby. But no one from security tried to remove him, they just let it happen. I never felt safe at this hotel, and I did not like it at all. The room safe never worked, and I called security twice to come fix it, and the security could not fix the problem. I constantly had to ask for towels, and wash cloths, and the shower head was for a 4"10" person. So if you're tall, you will not want to take a shower. Overall, I give this hotel a 1 on a scale of 1 to 10. Stay west of Lexington, because then you are closer to all of the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible suite, spectacular views of the Chrysler Building and delightful staff!”
Reviews.Author: ZacharyN
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Court after attending a wedding at The Ritz. We contemplated staying at The Ritz but preferred the location and boutique nature of The Court. After spending Saturday night in a very large suite at The Court I can say we certainly made the right decision. The staff was attentive, professional and friendly. From valet service for our car, running up complimentary toiletries or simply calling the room to see if we were happy with our beautiful accommodations, this is an excellent hotel. Opening my eyes and seeing the Chrysler building was a nice surprise as well. There is also a great bar, Lexbar, in the lobby of the sister hotel next door. We've stayed everywhere but we will be back to The Court. The people running this place know what they're doing!

Reviews.Title: “A great base for Manhattan, with outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: David186336
Reviews.Content: As with any major City, this hotel is not the cheapest but there is more to value than price alone and it scored top marks for rooms and service. We stayed both sides of the NY Marathon and the hotel laid on a special 5.00am breakfast for us full of marathon friendly pasta, rice, salads, bagels etc etc etc - they even packed us off with goodie bags! Even if you are not Marathon running, the level of attentive service blew away any preconceptions of NY hospitality. A 5 minute walk to Grand Central, I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Finally - a hotel in New York that doesn't feel like a hotel...”
Reviews.Author: dotravel01
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel like you actually live in New York while you are there -- this is the place for you. Right off Park Ave. in a charming neighborhood, the Giles is delicately tucked away from the hussle and bussle in a more residential area. Warm apple cider greets you in the lobby where the subdued lighting makes you feel instantly cozy and at home. The view of the city from the room at night is something I will never forget. The staff was warm and welcoming and the room felt more like an apartment than a sterile hotel room. Highly recommend a stay here your next time in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have had a better experience”
Reviews.Author: singerchatter
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine giving this hotel anything other than the highest rating. Our experience here was amazing. We were in a blizzard in NYC and I had a very sick child. They went to extreme lengths to help us, even going so far as to go out in the blizzard to get her medicine. And bringing up complimentary tea and cookies so she could take it. The breakfast hostess at the Audrey went above and beyond to help her eat and to get our breakfasts for us. Our bellhop went to extreme lengths to make sure we were cared for. The rooms were beautiful and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Galipan
Reviews.Content: As a former "W" it is a very interesting hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic and the views of the Chrysler Building were fantastic! We got a room with a small balcony and really enjoyed the views! The "only" thing... the people on the surrounding rooms where VERY noisy, getting back from the bar around 4 am... speaking laud and slamming doors with no consideration to the other people that might be sleeping...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Huge Rooms! Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl517
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Giles the Court, from December 25 -- 29. We booked through Travelocity's "secret" hotels program. When we arrived, they had booked us into a King room, when we had requested (and confirmed) a room with double beds. Since they didn't have one, they upgraded us to a suite! This suite was HUGE. 2 rooms, one with a pull out couch, flat screen TV, desk, mini bar. The bedroom had a king bed, flat screen TV, chair, Ipod dock. My only complaint is that WiFi should be included in the price of the room. We paid $15 a day to connect to the WiFi. That's really high, but we needed access to the internet. The location is fabulous, the rooms were huge and clean, and we got a great deal through Travelocity. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jaf07
Reviews.Content: Three friends of mine and I stayed here last weekend. The hotel was in a very convenient location but not in a touristy crowded area. It was only a short walk to most tourist attractions and access to the subway. We booked this hotel through oyster.com which worked out great. When arriving at the hotel the lobby was very crowded and our room was not ready for about 20 minutes which was an inconvenience to us because we had tickets to a show. When entering the room we were impressed with how large the room was for a nyc hotel. The bathroom was a little on the small size but was nothing we couldnt manage. The beds were very very comfortable and I did not hear any noise at night that other patrons had mentioned in other reviews. The elevator is also very small ( very difficult to fit four people and their luggage into one). The front desk staff and all doormen were very friendly. Also coming home at late hours into the late and there being a door man at all hours was very nice and made us feel safe. The only complaints we had were that the house keeping accidently took one of the head towels we had brought from home when they got the other towels (ours was bright pink) so I am not sure how they managed to do that, however with several phone calls to the front desk we were able to get it back. After that we put the do not bother sign on the door so they would not come in and the next day at 8 am they called our room to see if they could come in. If I am on a trip I do not want to be waken up by a phone call at 8am! Also I used a debit/visa card to hold the room and the lady at the front desk said I would be able to use that card without any problems. I used my card several times at different establishments and my card worked but when I checked my balance it was negative because of the hold from the room. Therefore I had to pay an overdraft fee and contact both my bank and the hotel to get this taken care of. My advice dont hold the room on a card that you plan on using if it is a debit/check card. Overall great rooms, great location, good price. The negatives of this hotel would not keep me from coming back but I do think they should work on those areas.

Reviews.Title: “HANDYMAN SPECIAL”
Reviews.Author: Fastidiousfredz
Reviews.Content: The owner's formula for running this hotel is simple: charge as much as the market will bear and get away with absolutely the least maintenance as possible. My room was on one of the upper floors and upon entering immediately smelled of mold (which is not surprising since there is no bathroom vent). I cranked open the window and turned off the noisy heating system. This is a run down hotel. The bathroom is tiny and it is difficult to shave if you are right handed. The bathroom light was not working (was quickly fixed) the hot water tap was falling apart. The soap holder in the shower fell off the wall. The walk-in shower drain was partially plugged flooding the bathroom floor. I had an early meeting so I decided to breakfast in the hotel. Big mistake! and I now know why the restaurant was empty. Do yourself a favour, close your eyes , spend a few more bucks and instead go to a hotel that cares about it's patrons

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Area”
Reviews.Author: jamileemorgan
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and helpful. The location was perfect- it was so close to everything we wanted to do and see yet it was in a quieter neighborhood that offered a different city feel away from all of the very crowded hotels and tourist attractions even though it was only a walking distance away. The rooms were very nice, had a European feel to them. Very nice TV's with a DVD player, which was a very good thing to have. Overall, I had a very nice experience with St. Giles-The Court and would love to go back any chance I got.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, convenient location. Very cool atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: rosscoe7999
Reviews.Content: Loved the St. Giles. We never stayed in the Murray Hill area before, and it is lovely. Streets are quiet and safe, but just a few blocks to Grand Central and all the other action. We were upgraded to a King suite with a balcony, with a great view of the Chrysler building. We were treated very well from all of the staff. We went to the almost-next door St. Giles Tuscany for a quick breakfast in the cafe, which was also very cool. Server there was friendly and the bagel was great. It wasn't cheap by any means, but...given the location, the cool atmosphere, the polite treatment...it was well worth every penny and I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “excellent what a stylish place. worth what I spent”
Reviews.Author: larryKrug
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St giles court in November. everything was perfect. the rooms were huge especially for New York. I got a good rate although I think it varies a lot. matresses perfect staff friendly and helpfull willing to help with finding you places calling anyone for you. A real concierge service, beds were perfect, location is perfect , I love the village but it made me love midtown as well, it was my 10th trip to New York and this hotel made it the best and made everything else worthwhile, I highly recomend it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: essovendere
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel when clients are in town because of its location on the east side. It fast to all airports via Midtown Tunnel. I have always been upgraded and this has made me come back time and time again. Great part of the city

Reviews.Title: “I expected more.”
Reviews.Author: spud1313
Reviews.Content: The service and location of the hotel were definitely great, but the room was sub par. Bathroom and especially the shower were lacking (and not that clean) and the air conditioner in our room was so loud that it kept us awake most nights. We eventually turned it off and suffered through an overheating room instead. Also, big closet was nice, but with very little hanging space and a tiny dresser, wasn't that useful. Also, the couch in our room was filthy.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: buzymom5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 3 teenagers stayed in a king suite for 2 nights November 20 & 21st. We had gotten a very good price on travelzoo and we liked that it was so close to Grand Central Station. Everything was very clean. I was very pleased with the central location, however the intersection made the location a little nosier than I would have liked. The suite was very large, especially by NYC standards and we all had plenty of room to spread out. The king sized bed was very comfortable. There was ample room for a cot for my daughter. The pull out sofa was clean but some of the support under the mattress was broken, so it really needs to be updated. Overall we were very pleased with the accomodations, traveling with a family of 5 often means getting 2 rooms, which can get expensive. There was a really great room with comfy couches and a fireplace in the lobby, I really wished we had time to enjoy that. Maybe next time as we would not hesitate to stat here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot, great serice, special and polite hoteal team”
Reviews.Author: crisdegani
Reviews.Content: (continues...) The spot is rocks on NY, btw Lex & 39th st, close than Park Ave and Gran Central. Lots to do near than the hotel, like running to Brooklin Bridge and enjoying the Bryant Park. The price is ok, average on U$ 260.00. On the corner, you can reach some delis and should buy your breakfast. Ask for coffeemaker in the room. Tomight the hotel rocks becaue

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gigimlc
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the hotel - it was a central location and not too expensive. We were upgraded to a suite at checkin - the room was HUGE. Comfortable bed. Small bathroom. Cool bar in the lobby. Not the fanciest, but it was fine. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Barney065
Reviews.Content: We found a hidden gem in New York City. The St Giles Hotel - The Court New York. Our room was huge (and we don't need the disclaimer "by New York Standards". It was the three "C's". Clean, convenient, and comfortable. All of this with an added bonus of the best bath products I've ever found in a hotel. The Treatments products are wonderful. These folks should market these products. A special thanks to Nicole Winckler for her knowledge and help! We will be back . . . hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base in New York”
Reviews.Author: saraflo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 week from 18 - 25 October. It's very convenient to all the major places to visit and of course the shopping! Rooms were big for NY and very very clean. As there has been much written about the bed bug situation in the city we really gave our room close inspection and it passed with flying colours. The staff are helpful and pleasant the consierge was extremely helpful regarding subway maps, store closing times and indeed everything we asked about. At night there was entertainment at the hotel and although we didn't go into the bar area we are delighted to report once we were in our room we couldn't hear it. There was no traffic noise at night and we heard only the odd siren whereas hotels nearer Times Square can be a bit noisey. We will definately use this hotel again. I honestly can't think of anything negative to report.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: jberges
Reviews.Content: I have stayed numerous times at the Court hotel when it was the W and now as part of the St Giles Hotel chain. The hotel is as good or better then when it was under the W name and at better rates then the W. The rooms are spacious and the service is excellent. If your looking for a place to stay that is close to everything and at a affordable rate, this is the place to stay. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: audreydoll
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline and at check-in, the only mention of Priceline was that it was a prepaid reservation. The very friendly staff member asked what type of room we wanted and we asked if they had one with nice view. We were given an upgrade to a very nice room on a high floor with a view of the Empire State Building. The room was great, very clean and comfortable. The location was very convenient and a quick walk from GCT. I had a great experience at this hotel and woud happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Girl67
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to this hotel. We have been in NY for many times and this time we wanted to experience a different hotel. The hotel is nicely located, near a subway. We had a corner room at the back so pretty quiet. Room had for NY standard a lot of space, bathroom on the other hand had not. It was old yet clean and if you took a shower the water in the bathtub took ages to flow away. Check in was decent and our safe was broken the first day and they replaced it immediately. So on average pretty decent but for the price they ask for the room per night it could be better

Reviews.Title: “The Phoenix has risen.”
Reviews.Author: PhillyTraveler19147
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the location I was curious to see what changes had happened over the past few months - and, more importantly, what was on the horizon. The overall vibe is still W - but you can see the St. Giles personality starting to shine through. The warm response upon check in; even the greetings from housekeeping as you passed in the halls. Very warm indeed. We stayed in suite 1501 - a corner property overlooking the Empire State Building. The space was clean and offered a overly-comfortable chaise alongside the window. The only downfall was the lack of drawers - thankfully we were just there for am overnight but if i was there for a week I'd tire living out of a suitcase. I was told a major renovation to the rooms in in place - heres hoping they keep the W swank while offering a bit more use in in room. Being overnight we didn't take full advantage of the hotel amenities but we did stop in the Lex Bar - I had been here a few times before and was disappointed with the abrasive music ( cheesy 80s remixes mixed with no bass and at high volume - so loud you couldn't even hear the person next to you!) Additionally the drink prices are absurd. Now I drink top shelf vodka, so I'm used to premium pricing. Even still - a Kettle One and soda is $13!! Insane. Overall - a hotel i hope to return to once the renovations are complete

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not four star”
Reviews.Author: Anne011
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through the "secret sale" on Quikbook, which rated it four stars. It was fine on many levels, but a four star it's not. The most annoying things were the lack of shelf space and decent lighting in the bathroom -- two issues that I think would matter to anyone over the age of 10. They didn't even have the box of Kleenex in the bathroom -- there was no room for it! And it wasn't Kleenex, but rather a cheaper and inferior brand. The bathroom was large but the space was mostly useless. Really needs a new design. Otherwise, the bed was comfortable, room was quiet (though I'd strongly suggest staying on an upper floor away from their Lex bar, which plays loud, pulsing music way into the wee hours), staff was nice and accommodating, and you can't beat the neighborhood. But I had just stayed at a Westin, which really is a four star hotel. I would rate the St. Giles a three star, and certainly wouldn't pay the going rate of $400 a night.

Reviews.Title: “What a Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LSH12
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my 50th birthday with friends in New Your at the St Gile - The court. It could not have been better! The staff was gracious , the rooms enormous and well appointed and the location could not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Scotlandscout
Reviews.Content: Booked through a 3rd party on the advice of another TA member and saved a great deal on the room rate. We had a room at the back of the hotel which suited us away from the traffic at the front. But if there are people outside the bar area it could get noisy. Room a good size, all the usual mini bar, iron, safe etc. Bed linen good, but the quilt with the silky cover caused the quilt to be constantly slipping down the bed, along with the quilts contents. Bed comfortable (and yes I did check after all the problems with bed bugs, and the mattress was immaculate) but it did have a rather annoying squeak each time I moved. Good reading lights, but hated the fabric headboard, think they are just grime hoarders. The room itself was very clean, but furniture was rather worn and chipped and things that were previous there when it was a W hotel left large gaps in the drinks area. Bathroom, clean, serviceable but the shower pressure was dreadful, and there was nowhere to place anything (ie toilet bags) except the floor, or on top of the toilet. Shame as there was plenty wall space to put at least a shelf. Towels good quality as were the toiletries. One big irritation was the monster of the air conditioner which roared into action. I have never stayed in a hotel with ones that make so much noise, or indeed in my own home. The position of the hotel as mentioned before is great, a convenience store over the road and plenty of places all around to eat/drink. Used Starbucks fro the WIFI, really object to paying for it in a hotel. We did not eat/drink in the hotel, staff ok, found them not unfriendly but a little cold. You can also get the bus to the airport (JFK) not far away which is a big saving. Compared to other hotels, The St Giles was priced well, but only using a booking agent. Think after the change over from the W chain, rooms should be looked at for a bit of tidying up.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to spacious corner room...gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: winstontoocute
Reviews.Content: What a great find this hotel is! 39th and Lexington is close to Grand Central station subway and cute bar/restaurants in the immediate neighborhood. I must have been bumped up to a corner room in the quiet side of the hotel...without realizing it! The room was spacious, compared to other nyc hotels and king bed was super comfortable. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good and central”
Reviews.Author: cardifftravellers
Reviews.Content: We arrived early at the hotel which was not a problem at all, they booked us into a very good room straight away. It was light and spacious. The bed was confortable and the bedding was lovely, it was changed every day as were the towels. Air conditioning was a bit noisy when we arrived and wouldn't shut off, and we couldn't work out how to open the safe, we phoned down and someone came and looked at both within 15 minutes. Staff were friendly and helpful, it was our first trip to New York and would certainly stay at this hotel again, it was so convenient, we were able to walk to most places within 15 minutes, Grand Central was just around the corner. There were lots of restaurants and bars on the next block!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BeStylish
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the St. Giles, which I had not heard of before, but I was very pleased with the hotel, my room and the service. Everyone was extremely helpful from check-in to directions to getting me a ticket to a NY fashion show! The rates were excellent and the location was just off the beaten track but still easily accessible to everything. I can't wait until my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and contemporary hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: sammielc
Reviews.Content: The hotel hasnt changed since St Giles taken over from The W. Main difference is really the lack of bliss products and no hot food lunch/evenings, and the bar isnt as crowded! However rooms are still very comfortable with contemporary designs, comfortable beds, and service is very good, views are amazing. i would say $16+ per day for wifi is very high, when you can go down the block to Starbucks and use theirs for free. Good stay, and would return.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajlcdl
Reviews.Content: As a native New Yorker, I look forward to my occasional trips back and always looking for the near perfect hotel in each part of Manhattan. I may have found it for mid-town. I recently stayed at The Court with my two sons for one night while we were in town for the US Open. I found it after reading reviews on Trip Advisor - the location and value seemed hard to beat, and this is certainly true. The hotel is not too big, the staff are extremely friendly and helpful, and the rooms were great. Fresh cookies, cold punch and apples and the NY Times and WSJ are at the desk in the lobby. Even the shower had good pressure - a rarity for hotels these days. I requested a room with a king bed and a cot, to fit the three of us, and were told on arrival that a cot would be forthcoming, but never did. The desk staff explained that the room was too small for a cot, and before I could get out any argument, they immediately upgraded us to a suite. One of the hotel staff (I think he was the security and doorman all in one) plus a housekeeper accompanied us to the room and helped transfer all our belongings while the housekeeper prepared the pull-out bed from the living room couch. The security dude even got us some fresh ice for our waters. The beds were great, and the next morning, after visiting the Starbucks a block away, which opens at 5:30, I enjoyed the morning newspaper in the very comfortable and quiet lounge. All in all this was a really great place and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, colorful and the most comfortable bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: Aromatic
Reviews.Content: This hotel was worth visiting if just for the bed! In a word..."plush." Spacious, classy, colorful, eclectic, clean, centrally located, accommodating, welcoming....and excellent rates. Thank you St. Giles. I'm from San Diego and visit New York a few times a year...this will be my New York "coming home" hotel indefinitely. Wonderful, friendly staff, handsome doormen, walk-in closets, clean bathrooms with space for toiletries...and those pillows!....yum!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Nads82
Reviews.Content: Traveled on business to NYC. Had a nice warm welcome upon arriving to the hotel. Everyone that works there is friendly and helpful. The rooms are very large for a NYC hotel and the value was outstanding. The room was clean and very functional. I had a great stay here and plan to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon - you made it special”
Reviews.Author: PhilandAnnV
Reviews.Content: I am not an expert in hotel reviews but have spent my entire working career (40 yrs) as a user throughout North America. There are various things that will tip the scale for me but friendliness and clenliness are on the top of my list. The Tuscany had it all. The GM (David Lopez) was a star in our sky as he made a wonderful visit to New York become an amazing visit. His style and approach to our special time was unsolicited, unexpected and so appreciated. Try this hotel as I expect you will be more than pleased. Cheers Tuscany

Reviews.Title: “I'm Movin' In.....”
Reviews.Author: be_art_56
Reviews.Content: Although it has been a couple of weeks, the memory of my stay lingers on! First, if I only new what awaited me, I may have made plans for days in advance! You graciously took me in even though I was a day late! You took my bags for safe keeping while I was whisked away by my wild and wonderful friends for the river tour! Our group filled the public spaces of both the Court and the Tuscany and all I ever witnessed from hotel hosts were smiles and pure accommodation! For this and my Wonderful room (for which I want to move into), I am most grateful! This was a most special reunion among friends of 25-30 yrs! You helped make this a seamless journey of renewal!! With much gratitude!

Reviews.Title: “Totally Enjoyable...”
Reviews.Author: cromaner
Reviews.Content: The St. Giles was an awesome place to stay. The location made everything so easy from getting to and from the airport to being very centrally located, it just was perfect. As soon as we walked up to the hotel being greeted by warm and friendly "security guys" at the door, we knew things were a little different. I saw the same guys every time I went in and out and you couldn't help but strike up a bit of a friendship. The room was surprisingly large (for NY) and had a very clean, modern and comfortable feel to it. Very pleasant, comfortable place to stay along with friendly, efficient staff. They get my recommendation with both thumbs UP! Carl Romaner

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased! Great Staff, Great Suite, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JenChris05
Reviews.Content: We are a well-traveled couple in our early 30's and were looking to enjoy the city for our 5th anniversary along with a final celebration before our first baby arrives in September. I do a lot of research for our vacations - typically looking for hidden gems or great value deals on premium places. I also own a vacation rental company for the community where our beach house is located so I have a lot of experience with all aspects of guest management. We have high expectations for attention to detail and customer service and could not have been more impressed. In honor of our anniversary and upcoming baby, we received a complementary room upgrade. The suite was very clean, spacious with walk in closet and decorated with stylish yet comfortable decor (see pictures). We also had a terrace balcony with a nice view of the Chrysler building. The suite was stocked with all the amenities. We felt completely safe and the hotel is perfectly located for walking (or quick cab) to the major attractions... just a few blocks to shopping on 5th Ave, Time Square, The Empire St Buiding, etc. It is also ideally located with regard to ease of access for getting into and out of the city to make travel days less stressful. The staff, including but not limited to Blanca and Jennifer, are top notch and a great asset! They even added a surprising personal touch by sending a gift package to congratulate us on our upcoming baby. They were very professional, warm and welcoming while handling the reservation and check-in process. Our only regret is that we could not stay longer but can hopefully return again sometime soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel location”
Reviews.Author: cmenendez22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last week in July 2010; We had a nice welcome by the doorman; he assisted us with a taxi if needed; housekeeping was great not one complain; the hotel itself was nice; just what you see on the webpage of the hotel is what it appears in your room and the lobby area; checking in was nice and smooth and so was checking out; hotel itself is nice all staff nice and friendly; bar was nice but a bit pricy for 1 drink! But hey it’s a bar I guess; overall experience loved it! Not one complain …

Reviews.Title: “they bend over backwards”
Reviews.Author: mobaby00
Reviews.Content: Kudos to St. Giiles Hotel the Court in New York City. Pleasant, accommodating - they remembered our names without a cue from us. Made great suggestions on what to do. I'd go back anytime. Nice place, nice room and very conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times at The Court”
Reviews.Author: smeyer99
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried when W Hotels sold the property after I booked our trip, but I was pleasantly surprised. Everyone at the hotel was very nice and incredible helpful. We had two rooms (a double and a suite) and both were very large by NYC standards. The beds were extremely comfortable and the bathrooms were well appointed. We didn't notice any street noise, but we were on the 14th floor. We had an AC issue the first day, but a short call to the front desk had a service tech to our room in 10 minutes or less to fix the problem. There was 1 elevator working for the first 2 days of our stay, but both were working on Friday and Saturday. They were small and sometimes it took a few minutes to get on one, but it wasn't a big deal. I would certainly stay at The Court again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but can be better”
Reviews.Author: RyanA94
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 7 days in June 2010. I was pleasantly surprised that the hotel was in tip-topped condition. Almost everything was perfect. The housekeeper were very friendly greeting us everytime they saw us. They tidied our room and was very organized. The bad point was the air condition in the room. It was too loud for comfort. We told the reception before we left the hotel and they said that the will sent the technician right away. However, when we returned after an hour, the technician did not even come to the room. We called the reception again and the technician came and check the A/C unit and told us that they is nothing they can do and asked if we wanted to change rooms. We did and the A/C unit was still loud but not as loud as the previous room. The location of the hotel wasn't too convenient, it was quite a distance to times square and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Large & comfy room, nice staff, room service $$$ expensive”
Reviews.Author: MaineIzzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 1015 for three nites - huge suite with a queen-sized bed and THREE closets. Considering I paid $169 on quikbook for a double room, the upgrade was amazing/wonderful. Partial view of Empire State Building. Room was clean, comfy and huge. It could use a little love: carpets are frayed and bathroom sink was missing hardware. Bed was very comfortable and street noise wasn't bad on the tenth floor (A/C muffled most hotel and street noise - and since bedroom isn't near hallway, it was great not to hear doors slam all the time). Water pressure in shower was good, tho the showerhead sputtered and shook. Two robes in room and plenty of pillows. This could be a really great hotel with a few changes - some minor room updates and more even service. When I arrived, there was no one to open door or greet me. Considering I was schlepping three bags, a little help would have made a great first impression. Computers were down and check in was delayed til about 3:45, an inconvenience that would've been better tolerated if staff had communicated updates to all travelers waiting. An offer of free wifi and a refreshment would've gone far on a 95-degree day waiting in a lobby. Most of the staff encountered were professional and helpful, especially the woman at the front desk who arranged the upgrade to a suite. The room service charges were outrageous, not a surprise but still always a disappointment to be gouged. There are other hotels, such as the Lucerne on the UWS, that don't feel compelled to rip off customers. Murray Hill is not a very exciting neighborhood but it's safe and an easy walk to Grand Central, Macy's and midtown. There's a dearth of green/open space in this neighborhood, but the hotels are often so well priced compared to other areas, you can live without the park. Would recommend this hotel if you're looking for a large and comfy room and if you can get it for cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Travellers_Checklist
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at St. Giles - The Court. This hotel offered reasonable room rates, excellent service, nice accomodations, and a convienent location. It is located only a few blocks from Grand Central Terminal which makes it easy to take the subway around the city. It is also within walking distance to the Empire State Building and Macys, even Times Square if you don't mind walking a little farther. The hotel does have a bar attached to it. I personally found it small and the prices a bit expensive (even for NYC) so I would recommend going elsewhere for a drink. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff were very helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for such a plush midtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Ellie_C
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here I was slightly nervous about my stay at St Giles, however it exceeded all my expectations. Staff helpful, great atmosphere, location fantastic for midtown shopping, and my room was large, plush, comfortable and clean. Only complaint was the prices in the bar ($14 for a small glass wine!) but only to be expected in a hotel such as this, I suppose. BTW I got a great deal on priceline for this hotel ($180 per night) so this definitetly made it great value.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoCruiser
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. I loved the view and my room was very clean. It was close to many attractions and shopping. I even took the public transit back to LGA airport. It was easy. 1 train and a bus. But, the staff are so amazingly nice. They gave us umbrellas, directions, advice on where to go, booked a fantastic restaurant for dinner, and let us check in early. I was on a celebrity cruise a few years ago and I loved the service. The hotel made me feel that way. They were always there to help and make my stay the absolute best. I wasn't intruding and they really cared and made my trip magical. Thank you so kindly for everything. I would definitely choose your hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but that is where the good ends.”
Reviews.Author: htram
Reviews.Content: I have been to NYC 3 times in the past few months for pleasure/business and I have to say this is the worst hotel experience I have had. Not that it was awful, it was not, but just not as pleasant as others. First the good, the rooms were HUGE by NYC standards and the bed was super comfy. The shower products were nice and the pressure in the shower was nice. Now the bad, our comforter(yes I know hotel comforters are gross, but this was more gross than normal) had a stain on it that looked like semen! Super gross. The blind fell off in the middle of the night and woke us up, and the street noise was awful. This may have been because we were on the 3rd floor, but it was hard to fall asleep and we were woken early by the hustle on the street. I will end on a positive. This is on 39th/Lexington and is in walking distance of many good places, so b/c of this, I may consider staying again if I were on a higher floor away from the street, but I would never pay full price. We booked through a discount travel sight, thankfully, as I would never pay $400 for a night in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value + great service”
Reviews.Author: Rica_Fe
Reviews.Content: Loved the rooms, the atmosphere and the service (bell man, concierge, front desk, phone person were all very friendly). Cleanliness in the rooms need to improve. Location is not trendy, but not far from all the main areas. Overall the value was great, very satisfied for the cost x benefit.
